finding: The sentinel variant rs766169 was associated with long-term varenicline effectiveness (LVE) and is linked to genes involved in transcriptional regulation, emphasizing its role in treatment efficacy.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The SNP rs2239785 in the APOL1 gene was identified as a significant risk factor specifically for diabetic macular edema (DME) in individuals of African ancestry, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.71 and a very low p-value (P=5.05×10^-23). This variant was shown to increase apolipoprotein L1-induced cytotoxicity, indicating its functional relevance. Notably, higher allele frequencies in African American patients correlated with increased DME risk.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS analysis identifies two novel loci associated with diabetic eye disease and highlights APOL1 as a high risk locus in patients with diabetic macular edema

finding: The variant rs5030613, found within the intronic region of the DERL3 gene on chromosome 22q11.23, demonstrated an association with lower PRU values. This association was supported by a beta coefficient of -33.53, with a confidence interval of -46.76 to -20.3, and a p-value of 9.42×10^-7. The SNP was linked to a protective role in heart function.
title: Discovery of Ancestry-specific Variants Associated with Clopidogrel Response among Caribbean Hispanics

finding: The SNP rs4680 was a missense variant within COMT, linked to altered protein expression. It demonstrated a base change from G to A, which was associated with a V to M amino acid change and a reduction in COMT expression, consistent with mass-spectrometry findings.
title: Dual site proteomic analyses reveal potential drug targets for cardiovascular disease

finding: This variant is prominently linked to <italic>FBLN1</italic> and indicated strong significance in relation to PSA values.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The Ile148Met variant (rs738409) of the PNPLA3 gene was found to be associated with hepatic steatosis. This association was identified through genotyping performed on samples from the QHLI Obesity Biobank, which highlighted its role in the presence and severity of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
title: Altered branched-chain α-keto acid metabolism is a feature of NAFLD in individuals with severe obesity

finding: the lead signal for cannabis use disorder (CUD) mapped to FAM19A5, signaling its role in brain-specific mechanisms and histone modification.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The germline variant rs1014971 was found to be associated with increased APOBEC3B expression and bladder cancer risk. This association was particularly pronounced in tumors harboring BK polyomavirus (BKPyV), which had significantly higher average APOBEC3B expression compared to both normal tissues and tumors without viral presence. The highest average APOBEC3B expression was observed in tumors containing BKPyV and two copies of the rs1014971 variant, suggesting a correlation between this SNP, viral presence, and enhanced expression of genes linked to DNA damage responses and tumorigenesis.
title: Evidence for Virus-Mediated Oncogenesis in Bladder Cancers Arising in Solid Organ Transplant Recipients

finding: The variant rs1135824 was selected to assign naive CNV-calls in the study, where it contributed to the preliminary copy number variant (CNV) assignments based on total signal intensity, aligning with expected frequencies of CNV genotypes.
title: Low-cost generation of clinical-grade layperson-friendly pharmacogenetic passports using oligonucleotide arrays

finding: Similar to rs1135824, the variant rs1423323203 was utilized for naive CNV-calls, aiding in the assessment of CNV genotypes through signal intensity measurements.
title: Low-cost generation of clinical-grade layperson-friendly pharmacogenetic passports using oligonucleotide arrays

finding: The rs4819670 SNP was identified as the lead variant at the USP18 locus, which colocalised with a GWAS lead variant for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in East Asians. The C allele of rs4819670 was associated with decreased expression of multiple type I interferon response genes and a reduced risk of SLE.
title: USP18 modulates lupus risk via negative regulation of interferon response

finding: The rs3180408 SNP was a missense variant in the USP18 gene which was linked to decreased USP18 protein function. It was determined that the T allele conferred a higher risk for systemic lupus erythematosus, indicating an impaired regulation of type I interferon response genes.
title: USP18 modulates lupus risk via negative regulation of interferon response

finding: This SNP near PNPLA3 was previously associated with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, further affirming its connection to CAD through its metabolic roles.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: rs129415, a strongly correlated missense variant in SCUBE1, was associated with CAD through its role in thrombosis protection in mice.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The SNP rs229527 was associated with all types of hypothyroidism phenotypes, increasing the risk by a factor of 1.06-1.10, and was part of a gene known to intersect with multiple autoimmune diseases.
title: The Etiology of Hypothyroidism Is Revealed by Alternative Genetics Association Study Methodologies

finding: Similar to rs229527, the SNP rs229526 was linked to various hypothyroidism phenotypes and also increased the risk for autoimmune conditions, enhancing the understanding of its role in thyroid-related disorders.
title: The Etiology of Hypothyroidism Is Revealed by Alternative Genetics Association Study Methodologies

finding: The variant rs769258 achieved 100% concordance on Nala PGx Core compared to benchmark methods, reflecting its significance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The variant rs267608319 also demonstrated 100% concordance in genotyping assays on Nala PGx Core, illustrating its relevance in drug metabolism studies.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with tau deposition (P=2.20×10^-8) near the ISX gene, demonstrating a strong link to tau pathology in the analyzed cohorts.
title: Genome-wide scan of Flortaucipir PET levels finds JARID2 associated with cerebral tau deposition

finding: A recessive association was found between rs66812091, an intronic variant in the PNPLA3 gene, and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) with an odds ratio of 1.3 at a p-value of 2×10⁻¹². This was reported as more significant in the recessive analysis compared to the additive model. Dominance deviation also showed significance at 3×10⁻².
title: Widespread recessive effects on common diseases in a cohort of 44,000 British Pakistanis and Bangladeshis with high autozygosity

finding: This SNP corresponds to rs66812091, highlighting a recessive effect on NAFLD with an odds ratio of 1.3 at a highly significant p-value of 2×10⁻¹².
title: Widespread recessive effects on common diseases in a cohort of 44,000 British Pakistanis and Bangladeshis with high autozygosity

finding: The missense variant rs738409 in PNPLA3 was associated with 0.27 attributable DALYs in males but only 0.05 in females, demonstrating a substantial sex difference (P=1.0×10^-34). The overall effect was linked to chronic liver disease, with higher DALYs attributed to men.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The SNP rs738409 in the gene PNPLA3 was known to affect the risk of liver disease, indicating its potential role in hepatic steatosis and metabolic diseases.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: The rs6971 SNP was analyzed in a cohort consisting of patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD) and primary tauopathies. A significant group difference for rs6971 SNP status was observed (p = 0.036), indicating varying affinity binder classifications among the different cohorts (4RT, AD-CBS, AD, and controls). The distribution of medium (MAB) and high affinity binders (HAB) differed significantly across the groups, which suggested that the TSPO gene polymorphism potentially influenced microglial activation and clinical outcomes in these patients.
title: Individual regional associations between Aβ-, tau- and neurodegeneration (ATN) with microglial activation in patients with primary and secondary tauopathies

finding: The SNP rs60910145, part of the G1 alleles defined in the APOL1 gene, similarly indicated a significant increased risk of sepsis (OR=1.29; 95% CI, 1.00–1.67; p=0.047) in Black patients, though the association weakened after adjusting for severe renal disease.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and progression from infection to sepsis

finding: This SNP, located near XKR3, was noted for maintaining significance in non-cognitive measures, contributing further to discussions about its role in lipid signaling pathways.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: Associated with KIAA1671, this SNP was retained in the study wide analysis for non-cognitive measures, indicating potential implications in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: This intronic SNP in EP300 was also identified as study significant, with implications in association studies focusing on cortical thickness.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The rs555607708 variant in CHEK2 was positively associated with the risk of having multiple primary cancers, particularly among individuals with breast cancer (41.9%), prostate cancer (30.6%), melanoma (22.6%), and cervical cancer (16.1%). The odds ratio was calculated to be 2.72 with a p-value of 3.10×10^-6.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The SNP rs73885319 was associated with a significantly increased risk of sepsis with an odds ratio of 1.29 among Black patients hospitalized with infections, although this association was negated after adjusting for pre-existing severe renal disease.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and the occurrence of sepsis in Black patients hospitalized with infections: a retrospective cohort study

finding: The SNP rs60910145, part of the high-risk APOL1 genotypes, showed a similar pattern of association with sepsis as rs73885319, indicating a risk factor in the context of sepsis, again influenced by pre-existing renal conditions.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and the occurrence of sepsis in Black patients hospitalized with infections: a retrospective cohort study

finding: The SNP rs71785313 was identified as a component of the APOL1 high-risk genotype that was linked to increased risk of renal dysfunction in sepsis, with an odds ratio of 1.64, though this link diminished with adjustments for renal disease history.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and the occurrence of sepsis in Black patients hospitalized with infections: a retrospective cohort study

finding: The SNP rs12106505 was used as a proxy for the G2 allele in APOL1, showing associations with renal-related disorders and contributing to the understanding of increased risk for conditions such as hypertension-associated ESRD when combined with rs73885319.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and the occurrence of sepsis in Black patients hospitalized with infections: a retrospective cohort study

finding: The SNP rs142739979 was located in exon 11 of the BAIAP2L2 gene at locus 22q13.1, with a predicted non-frameshift insertion variant likely affecting the protein. It was reported as an eQTL of genes associated with various pathways, including those linked to neurodegeneration.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The study found that the genetic risk variant PNPLA3 (I148M) rs738409 improved the prediction of metabolic HCC cases when combined with differentially methylated CpGs and clinical variables. The base model including rs738409 yielded a validation AUC of 0.66, sensitivity of 0.80, and specificity of 0.45. Furthermore, in multifactorial modeling that included rs738409 along with key demographic and clinical variables, the overall prediction performance remained competitive compared to models using solely differentially methylated CpGs.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation markers associated with metabolic liver cancer

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 genotype was validated as a significant genetic risk factor for MASLD, with a significant association discovered between this genotype and liver fibrosis, assessed by fibroscan values. Adjusted models revealed p-values indicating a strong correlation with fibrotic progression in patients.
title: Mycobiome Dysbiosis and Genetic Predisposition for Elevated IL-17A Drive Fibrosis in MASLD

finding: The variant rs7287124 was identified as a lead eQTL for XBP1 expression in pancreatic islets. It was associated with lower beta-cell function and higher stimulated glucose in Asian Indians, with a specific finding of a -0.14 change in HOMA-B (P=5×10^-3) for each risk allele.
title: XBP1 expression in pancreatic islet cells is associated with poor glycaemic control across ancestries especially in young non-obese onset diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6010004 was found to be positively associated with dietary behavior as reported in the study by Vu et al. (2017), which examined how wearable sensors can effectively monitor food intake and improve nutritional outcomes. This finding suggested that individuals with this SNP may experience enhanced benefits from wearable technology in dietary monitoring.
title: Wearable Sensing in Eating Episode Monitoring: An Updated Systematic Review Protocol

finding: The SEC14L2 variant was associated with gamma-tocopherol/beta-tocopherol levels, suggesting involvement in vitamin metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The mEH Tyr61Ser polymorphism (rs2285097) was associated with altered enzyme activity, which has implications for the metabolism of Propylene Oxide (PO). This SNP was linked to increased susceptibility to certain cancers. The finding indicated that individual genetic variability could influence the detoxification process of environmental compounds like PO.
title: Biological Factors Influencing Individual Responses to Propylene Oxide: A Systematic Review of Exogenous Exposure, Endogenous Production and Detoxification

finding: The SNP rs142795512 identified a significant association with pregnancy loss (OR = 4.72, P = 9.64×10^-9). This intronic variant is situated within the TRMU gene, which produces a mitochondrial tRNA-modifying enzyme.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The SNP rs114058457 was linked to pregnancy loss, and it was previously identified as an expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) for TTC38, implicated in this outcome.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The SNP rs873492 from the MIRLET7BHG region was identified with a significant P-value of 4.80E-08, indicating its association with endometriosis.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The SNP rs2267161 within the GAL3ST1 locus was identified as a common missense variant (p.Met29Val) with strong associations to sulfatide blood lipid levels, implicating it in the risk of sCJD.
title: Multiomic Analyses Direct Hypotheses for Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Risk Genes

finding: The homozygous variant c.812T>C; p.T271I (rs760294168) in the MCAT gene was identified in a proband presenting with symptoms such as hypotonia, failure to thrive, and abnormal brain MRI findings. This variant was determined to be inherited in an autosomal recessive manner, showing high damaging prediction scores (CADD score of 28.9) and a very low frequency in gnomAD (2/251,156 alleles), with no homozygotes reported. The variant was also noted for its high conservation across species, indicating its potential significance in mitochondrial fatty acid synthesis and oxidative phosphorylation deficiencies.
title: Recessive pathogenic variants in MCAT cause combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency

finding: The study provided findings related to rs1135824, which was selected for naive copy number variant (CNV) calls in an effort to enhance pharmacogenomic (PGx) information. Specifically, it was used to bin total signal intensity to match expected CNV-calls, making it a significant variant within the PGx pipeline.
title: Low-cost generation of clinical-grade layperson-friendly pharmacogenetic passports using oligonucleotide arrays

finding: For rs1423323203, similar to rs1135824, it was utilized for naive CNV assignments and played a critical role in aligning genetic data for pharmacogenomic analysis, demonstrating its relevance in personalized medicine.
title: Low-cost generation of clinical-grade layperson-friendly pharmacogenetic passports using oligonucleotide arrays

finding: This SNP is associated with the development of NAFLD and affects triglyceride (TG) hydrolysis and retinol metabolism, which may increase the severity of the disease. It was emphasized in the study as a common genetic variant validated in multiple previous studies.
title: Quantitative genome-scale analysis of human liver reveals dysregulation of glycosphingolipid pathways in progressive nonalcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The SNP rs5751191, located on chromosome 22, was reported to have a genome-wide significant association with cognitive function, with a p-value of 2.02x10^-12. This SNP overlapped with the NDUFA6 gene, which had also demonstrated a significant association with educational attainment (EDU) in the analyzed PTV burden studies.
title: The impact of rare protein coding genetic variation on adult cognitive function

finding: Linked to MGAT3 as an eQTL, this variant displayed a significant association with transferrin glycosylation, contributing to our understanding of the genetic basis of this trait.
title: Exome sequencing reveals aggregates of rare variants in glycosyltransferase and other genes influencing immunoglobulin G and transferrin glycosylation

finding: The SNP rs7289446 was found to be intronic to SEZ6L and was associated with longitudinal measures of MS severity, specifically predicting time to irreversible EDSS 3 and 6 milestones, with adjusted hazard ratios (aHR) of 0.77 (p=0.008) and 0.72 (p=4.85×10-4) respectively. This indicated that carriers of the minor allele had a longer time to disability milestones in the context of MS severity.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: At 22q13.1, rs139911 was linked to the maximum area of the ascending aorta, showcasing genetic associations with sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs763121 was situated in the 3'UTR of the DDX17 gene, which encodes DEAD-box helicase 17. This SNP was linked to breast cancer, underscoring its involvement in the regulation of genes pertinent to cancer development.
title: A distinct class of pan-cancer susceptibility genes revealed by alternative polyadenylation transcriptome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs41260844 was associated with congenital heart disease (CHD) occurrence, where the minor allele (C) exhibited a higher risk (OR = 1.42, 95% CI = 1.11-1.81) and led to increased TBX1 promoter activity in both HEK 293T and H9C2 cells. Functional analyses revealed that this minor allele attenuated TBX1 promoter binding affinity with nuclear protein(s), suggesting a mechanism by which it enhances TBX1 transcription and contributes to CHD susceptibility.
title: Upregulation of TBX1 by genetic variants are associated with human congenital heart disease

finding: The minor allele of rs41298814 was identified as a risk factor for CHD, as its presence was also linked to an increased risk highlighted by haplotype analysis (OR = 2.38, 95% CI = 1.01-5.65). It was determined to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with other SNPs, indicating its potential role in affecting TBX1 regulation and CHD development.
title: Upregulation of TBX1 by genetic variants are associated with human congenital heart disease

finding: This SNP was noted for significant associations with PSA levels, suggesting implications for prostate cancer.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs6971 was associated with TSPO binding affinity, which determined participants' classification as high affinity binders (HAB), mixed affinity binders (MAB), or low affinity binders (LAB). Specifically, within the study sample, 55% of participants were categorized as HAB, 32% as MAB, and 13% as LAB, which aligned with previously reported frequencies. This finding suggested that the genotypic variation influenced the effectiveness of TSPO PET imaging in capturing inflammatory changes in the context of Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Alzheimer’s-associated inflammatory alterations mediate tau-associated neurodegeneration in limbic and temporal regions across clinical variants of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The G allele of rs738409 in the PNPLA3 locus was associated with increased levels of various triglycerides, specifically TG(57:10), TG(46:0), and TG(56:6) in the PROMIS study, indicating its role in lipid metabolism and potential implications for cardiovascular health.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The intronic variant rs12484809 in the PNPLA3 locus was significantly associated with triglycerides TG(56:6) and TG(56:5), suggesting its involvement in regulating triglyceride levels and potentially influencing cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The missense variant rs2267161 in the GAL3ST1 locus was associated with PG(32:1), suggesting its role in membrane glycolipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The SNP rs855791 in the TMPRSS6 gene was associated with systemic iron status, facilitating an understanding of the relationship between iron metabolism and atrial fibrillation. It was among those contributing to variations in iron biomarkers that were measured and analyzed in connection to atrial fibrillation risk.
title: Genetic support of a causal relationship between Iron status and atrial fibrillation: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs2413450 in the TMPRSS6 gene was found to be significantly associated with the 'Hemochromatosis Brain' phenotype at a p-value of 2.52×10^-50, highlighting its importance in the regulation of hepcidin, a key player in iron absorption.
title: Polygenic architecture of a novel MRI endophenotype: the “hemochromatosis brain”

finding: Variant rs855791 in TMPRSS6 was associated with increased interventricular septum T1 time (P = 5.65×10−10), linking iron regulation with myocardial fibrosis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs41260844 was associated with an increased risk of congenital heart disease (CHD), with the minor allele (C) being significantly enriched in CHD patients (p = 0.0041, OR = 1.42, 95% CI = 1.11-1.81). Functional studies indicated that this minor allele upregulated TBX1 expression and promoter activity, suggesting that higher levels of TBX1 contribute to CHD susceptibility.
title: Upregulated of TBX1 by genetic variants are associated with human congenital heart disease

finding: The minor allele of rs41298814 was identified as a risk factor for CHD. It was analyzed in haplotypes, and one specific haplotype containing the minor allele showed a significant association with increased CHD risk (p = 0.0049, OR = 2.38, 95% CI = 1.01-5.65), confirming its involvement in CHD occurrences.
title: Upregulated of TBX1 by genetic variants are associated with human congenital heart disease

finding: In the study, the G allele of rs738409 was identified as a genetic causal variant for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and was significantly associated with a reduction in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR). It was noted that those carrying the G allele had worse kidney function than individuals with other alleles. The causal inference was drawn from the significant association between genetically predicted NAFLD and lower eGFR values in individuals of white British ancestry, while associations were weakly non-significant in groups less likely to develop NAFLD, indicating that the observed effects were indeed mediated through NAFLD.
title: Causal effects from non-alcoholic fatty liver disease on kidney function: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs369250 variant in the THAP7 gene was associated with chronic kidney disease (CKD) and diabetic kidney disease (DKD). It was replicated with a suggestive P-value of 0.012 in the FinnGen GWAS data, indicating its relevance in the context of kidney complications.
title: Whole-exome and Whole-genome Sequencing of 1097 Individuals with Type 1 Diabetes Reveals Novel Genes for Diabetic Kidney Disease

finding: The SNP rs555607708 was identified as a frameshift variant in the gene CHEK2, showing significant association with later menopause (p = 1.6 x 10<sup>-27</sup>). This variant has been previously studied in the context of breast cancer.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: Frameshift variant rs587780174 in the CHEK2 gene was associated with later menopause (p = 1.7 x 10<sup>-9</sup>), supporting the role of CHEK2 in mechanisms affecting menopause timing.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: The SNP rs12628403, acting as a proxy for a germline 30kb deletion in the APOBEC3 region, was detected in 148 out of 552 ESCC cases (27%). It was associated with a decreased total APOBEC mutation burden, specifically for COSMIC signatures SBS2 and SBS13, with p-values of 0.007 and 1.0×10^-4, respectively. Additionally, this variant's frequency in ESCC from China and Japan was lower than expected in the general East Asian population (0.28 compared to 0.34), suggesting a potential protective role against ESCC.
title: Mutational signatures in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma from eight countries of varying incidence

finding: The SNP rs9610955 was noted as the only previously identified variant replicating significant association with FEV1 in the study, with a false discovery rate (FDR) q<0.05. It showed an association with FEV1 and had a p-value of 1.0×10^-4 and beta coefficient of -0.38 (95% CI = -0.58 to -0.19).
title: Multi-omic association study implicates PPP1R13B in DNA methylation-mediated genotype and smoking exposure effects on lung function in children living in urban settings

finding: The rs11090045 SNP, positioned near the CHADL gene, demonstrated an association with neuroticism. This finding further supports the importance of CHADL-related variants in the context of psychiatric disorders, including their potential impact on personality traits.
title: An oligogenic risk-model for Gilles de la Tourette syndrome based on whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs36062310 was identified as a putatively causal missense variant in the gene KLHDC7B, which had previously been uncharacterized in relation to hearing loss but showed a significant association with rare predicted loss-of-function variants.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The rs855791 variant in the TMPRSS6 gene was positively associated with other anemias, linking it to iron metabolism.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: The variant rs555607708, associated with a predicted loss-of-function in CHEK2, was identified as a pathogenic or likely pathogenic (P/LP) variant. It contributed to the assessment of breast cancer risk, indicating that women with this variant had a significant increase in the probability of being diagnosed with breast cancer, particularly when combined with polygenic risk scores.
title: Combining rare and common genetic variants improves population risk stratification for breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs855791 in the TMPRSS6 gene was identified as affecting iron metabolism and oral iron absorption. This finding was established in a study involving Taiwanese women, highlighting the variant's role in influencing iron-related phenotypes and its relevance to iron deficiency anaemia.
title: The global prevalence and ethnic heterogeneity of iron-refractory iron deficiency anaemia

finding: The study highlighted that the MYH9 rs11089788 polymorphism was significantly associated with long-term kidney allograft survival when considering both donor and recipient genotypes. Specifically, recipients with the AA-genotype receiving a kidney from a donor with the same AA-genotype experienced the highest risk of graft failure, with a hazard ratio of 1.68, indicating nearly double the risk of graft loss after kidney transplantation.
title: A non-muscle myosin heavy chain 9 genetic variant is associated with graft failure following kidney transplantation

finding: The SNP rs738409, located in the gene PNPLA3, was previously associated with an increased risk of liver disease, particularly non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This genetic variant was observed in individuals participating in studies focused on hepatic steatosis.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: This SNP was significant in the same meta-analysis as rs113446150, with a p-value of 1.7x10^-8. It also has an association with cognitive traits at its locus, contributing to the understanding of common variants' roles in rare neurodevelopmental conditions.
title: Dissecting the contribution of common variants to risk of rare neurodevelopmental conditions

finding: The study identified rs2294915 as a lead SNP within the 22q13.31 locus, which is associated with chronic nonalcoholic liver disease. This SNP was linked to multiple liver-related phenotypes in the Admixed American (AMR) population, showing significant correlation after adjusting for a range of EHR-derived phenotypes, thus affirming its relevance in the context of liver disease risk.
title: Leveraging genomic diversity for discovery in an EHR-linked biobank: the UCLA ATLAS Community Health Initiative

finding: Although not directly tested, rs738409 was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs2294915 in both AMR and European (EUR) populations. It is a missense variant in the PNPLA3 gene, previously documented as significant for susceptibility to liver diseases, confirming its critical role in genetic risk assessments concerning liver health.
title: Leveraging genomic diversity for discovery in an EHR-linked biobank: the UCLA ATLAS Community Health Initiative

finding: The lead variant rs917864, located in the 5' untranslated region of IL17RA on chromosome 22, was associated with psoriasis susceptibility (OR: 1.08, P=3.9×10^-9), linking it to the efficacy of brodalumab therapy.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: SNP rs202665 was found among the 42 SNPs linked to the common liability to addiction, indicating its relevance in this genetic architecture.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The COMT SNP-165599 was moderately associated with a change in PANSS negative score in African Americans treated with risperidone.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs5758064 was marked as the most significant SNP for the MCHR1 gene in excitatory neurons, being the lead SNP in the BIP GWAS as well. It indicated a potential neuron-specific enhancer function, crucial for MCHR1 regulation, which may influence mood regulation and circadian rhythm.
title: A unified framework for cell-type-specific eQTLs prioritization by integrating bulk and scRNA-seq data

finding: The CHEK2 loss-of-function variant c.1100del (rs555607708) was noted for imparting a moderate risk of breast and prostate cancer with a low frequency of 0.048% in the Northern Isles, suggesting a recent introduction due to immigration.
title: Two founder variants account for over 90% of pathogenic BRCA alleles in Orkney and Shetland

finding: The SNP rs555607708 was associated with early-onset infertility through a frameshift mutation (c.1100delC) in the CHEK2 gene. This mutation has been previously linked to increased risks of breast and ovarian cancer, and its association with infertility was further supported by evidence indicating a high odds ratio of 13.46 for polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
title: Inherited infertility - mapping loci associated with impaired female reproduction

finding: The rs738409-G allele in PNPLA3 was associated with chronic nonalcoholic liver disease and cirrhosis in individuals of EA and Hispanic American (HA) ancestry. Moreover, it was significantly correlated with abnormal liver function study results. Contradictory results from various studies regarding its impact indicated that the GG genotype heightened the risk of severe disease in patients younger than 65, while the rs738409-G allele was linked to reduced risks of hospitalization and mortality.
title: A comprehensive knowledgebase of known and predicted human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs73166864 was associated with COVID-19 susceptibility, positioned near the immunoglobulin lambda locus, important for antibody production and immune response.
title: AncestryDNA COVID-19 Host Genetic Study Identifies Three Novel Loci

finding: The study identified the SNP rs73885319, which is part of the high-risk G1 APOL1 genotype. The finding suggested that this variant, which corresponds to the missense variant p.S342G, contributed to progressive kidney disease in individuals with high-risk APOL1 genotypes.
title: Prevalence of Mendelian kidney disease among patients with high-risk APOL1 genotypes undergoing commercial genetic testing in the United States

finding: The SNP rs60910145 was also part of the high-risk G1 APOL1 genotype, defined by the missense variant p.I384M. The research indicated that carriers of this allele were at a higher risk for kidney disease, consistent with the findings related to the G1 genotype.
title: Prevalence of Mendelian kidney disease among patients with high-risk APOL1 genotypes undergoing commercial genetic testing in the United States

finding: The study found rs71785313, which characterized the G2 APOL1 high-risk variant through an in-frame deletion at codons 388 and 389. The presence of this deletion was associated with an increased risk of developing kidney diseases in individuals with these high-risk genotypes.
title: Prevalence of Mendelian kidney disease among patients with high-risk APOL1 genotypes undergoing commercial genetic testing in the United States

finding: The SNP rs134041 was significantly associated with lung function (p=1 × 10^-27), which may serve as a shared genetic pathway linking respiratory issues seen in COVID-19 patients and anxiety disorders.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs134016 showed a significant association with brain-imaging phenotypes (p=8 × 10^-19), indicating a potential link between brain structure variations and susceptibility to both anxiety and COVID-19 effects.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs6519133 in JOSD1, significant only in adjusted analyses, showed associations with C-reactive protein, indicating a potential relationship with liver inflammation.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: At the novel pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB) susceptibility locus 22q12.2, rs6006426 was associated with PTB with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.097, and a meta-analysis p-value of 3.31×10^-10. The A allele of rs6006426 correlated with reduced expression of SF3A1 in immune-related cells, and the SNP showed a significant association with cigarette smoking. Importantly, the A allele was linked to an increased risk for PTB, but a decreased likelihood of smoking, demonstrating a complex relationship in which smoking mediated the effect of rs6006426 on PTB susceptibility.
title: Common variants at 22q12.2 are associated with susceptibility to Tuberculosis

finding: The SNP rs7290267 near FLJ27365 was found to have a negative association with FEV1 (P=1.49×10^-9, β=-0.0272). No other significant prior associations were mentioned.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: This SNP was noted for significant associations in relation to PSA levels and cancer findings.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This intronic variant near CHEK2 was reported with a p-value of 9.69 × 10^-11. It was found to be in complete linkage disequilibrium with the c.1100delC frameshift variant, which is known to be enriched in the Finnish population and associated with a variety of outcomes, including genitourinary tract diseases and breast cancer.
title: Circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women: novel genetic insights from a GWAS meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel SNP located on chromosome 22 and was associated with externalizing behaviors. It shared phenotypic associations related to chronotype, schizophrenia, and social support.
title: A Multivariate Genome-Wide Association Study Reveals Neural Correlates and Common Biological Mechanisms of Psychopathology Spectra

finding: The SNP rs7292124, located near the ISX gene on chromosome 22, was found to be significantly associated with tau pathology, with a P-value of 2.20×10^-8. This association persisted upon adjustment for APOE-ε4 status.
title: Genome-wide scan of Flortaucipir PET levels finds JARID2 associated with cerebral tau deposition

finding: The SNP rs62228062 was identified as the first genome-wide significant variant associated with frozen shoulder (OR=1.34, p=2×10⁻¹⁶). It contained the gene WNT7B, which was highlighted in a transcriptomic study as significantly expressed in anterior capsule tissue of frozen shoulder patients. Additionally, rs62228062 was strongly associated with Dupuytren's contracture (OR=2.61, p<1×10⁻¹⁰⁰). This SNP demonstrated consistent association in both UK Biobank and FinnGen samples.
title: A genome wide association study of frozen shoulder identifies a common variant of WNT7B and diabetes as causal risk factors

finding: The SNP rs112809886 on Chromosome 22 was significantly associated with progression to Hoehn and Yahr stage 3 or greater, near GGT5, with the lead SNP associated with an eQTL for ADORA2A (p-value=1.9×10^-9).
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and clinical progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs5758550, identified in the enhancer region over 100 kb downstream of the CYP2D6 gene, was associated with significant increases in CYP2D6 transcription. This indicated its critical role in influencing CYP2D6 gene activity related to opioid metabolism.
title: The potential of CYP2D6 phenotyping to improve opioid dosing strategies

finding: Similar to rs5758550, SNP rs133333 located in the enhancer region was found to substantially enhance CYP2D6 transcription. This finding emphasized the importance of enhancer SNPs in modulating CYP2D6 function.
title: The potential of CYP2D6 phenotyping to improve opioid dosing strategies

finding: The SNP rs16947 was shown to have a substantial impact on CYP2D6 metabolic activity, particularly through its interaction with enhancer SNPs that can counteract its reduced function in approximately half of the carrying haplotypes. Its role was pivotal in determining metabolic outcomes and opioid response.
title: The potential of CYP2D6 phenotyping to improve opioid dosing strategies

finding: The RNF215 locus (lead SNP rs61583714) revealed a novel association with vitamin E levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The TMPRSS6 locus (lead SNP rs877908) confirmed a known association with iron levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: SNP rs73885319, associated with the G1 variant, was recognized in the context of APOL1 protein concentration studies. However, specific findings regarding its significance were not detailed in this analysis.
title: APOL1 variants G1, G2 and N264K affect APOL1 plasma protein concentration: a UK Biobank study

finding: SNP rs73885316 was associated with the N264K variant in APOL1 and was analyzed for its role in modifying the influence of other variants on APOL1 protein concentration.
title: APOL1 variants G1, G2 and N264K affect APOL1 plasma protein concentration: a UK Biobank study

finding: SNP rs71785313, which represents the G2 variant, was associated with significantly increased APOL1 protein concentration, reaching genome-wide significance in this study (p = 3×10−155).
title: APOL1 variants G1, G2 and N264K affect APOL1 plasma protein concentration: a UK Biobank study

finding: This SNP was associated with FEV1 (P=1.49×10^-9, β=-0.0272) and was found to be novel with no previous association with lung function traits.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs192493667 was genome-wide significant in the analysis comparing multiple cancers to single cancers (OR=1.39, P=3.6x10^-8), driven by the European population group.
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: SNP rs2413667 was linked to the missingness of solanidine and was identified as an expression Quantitative Trait Locus (eQTL) for CYP2D6, an enzyme involved in drug metabolism, suggesting a potential role in pharmacogenomics and dietary metabolism.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs3761472-G was associated with a significant odds ratio of 2.9 (2.0-4.1) for fatty liver disease (FLD) in patients with metabolic syndrome (MetS), indicating a strong link to severe phenotypes in the context of hepatic fat deposition.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs738409-G exhibited an odds ratio of 2.8 (1.9-4.07) for its association with fatty liver in individuals with metabolic syndrome, reinforcing its role as a critical variant implicated in hepatic fat accumulation.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: The association of rs35665085-A with an odds ratio of 2.7 (1.9-3.9) highlighted its potential impact on lipid metabolism and fatty liver disease within the context of metabolic syndrome.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: This SNP was found to be significant in both CD-PBC and UC-PBC analyses as part of the shared genetic architecture linking IBD and PBC.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: The variant rs62237617 at 22q12.1-<italic>CHEK2</italic> showed strong correlation with DNMT3A mutation-associated CH, thus enhancing the understanding of its implications on risk factors.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The tagging variant for the CHEK2 protein-truncating allele was associated with increased risk of DNMT3A-CH, revealing important insights into the genetic predisposition to clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: Associated with squamous cell carcinoma risk, this TTC28 variant was noted in rare cases.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This missense variant was associated with kidney-related conditions, such as end-stage renal disease, primarily in African populations.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The intergenic SNP rs133082 on chromosome 22 demonstrated a significant association with TRD, recording a beta of 0.0206 and a p-value of 1.82×10^-8 in the MGB TRD meta-analysis. This SNP was associated with decreased expression of MCHR1 in the dorsal lateral prefrontal cortex, linking it to previous findings in bipolar disorder.
title: Genome-wide association study of treatment resistant depression highlights shared biology with metabolic traits

finding: The COMT gene variant rs165599 was moderately associated with changes in PANSS negative scores, highlighting its potential impact on treatment efficacy.
title: Pharmacogenomic Diversity in Psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs111490516, located in the MTMR3 gene, was identified as a novel low-frequency variant associated with body mass index (BMI) in populations of African descent, particularly with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 13%. This finding was replicated across multiple studies, showing directionally consistent associations and highlighted the importance of diverse genetic data in BMI research.
title: WHOLE GENOME SEQUENCING ANALYSIS OF BODY MASS INDEX IDENTIFIES NOVEL AFRICAN ANCESTRY-SPECIFIC RISK ALLELE

finding: The SNP rs11538 was associated with the protein BCL2L13, which had a notable impact on dietary habits. It explained more than 60% of the colocalization probability concerning dietary habits and protein expression relevant to BMI.
title: Genetic control of body weight by the human brain proteome

finding: The SNP rs6006950 was significantly associated with decreased expression levels of the NUP50 gene in the DLPFC, indicated by a Z-score of -4 and a p-value of 7.5 x 10^-13. This association underlined the notion that the ALS risk allele (rs6006950-G) contributes to reduced NUP50 expression, which could be a risk factor for ALS.
title: Loss of nucleoporin Nup50 is a risk factor for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: Included in the investigation of causal variants, this SNP highlighted the need for follow-up studies in genetic contributions to ERM.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: This SNP was genotyped with 100% concordance using TaqMan DME Genotyping Assays and is part of the CYP2D6 gene, which is crucial for the metabolism of various drugs.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: Similar to rs769258, the SNP rs267608319 displayed 100% concordance in genotyping against established benchmarks, relating to the CYP2D6 gene and drug metabolism.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The SNP rs5760061 was associated with left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV) and was identified as a shared index variant in both the UK Biobank and Biobank Japan studies, indicating its relevance to cardiovascular health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: This missense variant was associated with blood hemoglobin levels and erythrocyte volume, impacting TMPRSS6.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The SNP <italic>SYN3/TIMP3</italic>:rs5754227-T was genome-wide significantly associated with retinal pigment epithelium and Bruch's membrane (RPE+BM) thickening, indicative of drusen development and AMD pathology.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The protective AMD variant <italic>TIMP3</italic>:rs9621532-C was noted for its moderate impact on TIMP3 mRNA transcription, suggesting a role related to RPE and AMD progression.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: SNP rs130121 showed a significant maternal origin bias and was associated with reproduction, implicating its potential role in preeclampsia risk.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The SNP rs133082, found in an intergenic region on chromosome 22, was significantly associated with TRD, having a P value of 1.82×10^−8 in the overall study, and an association trend in the VUMC cohort. This SNP showed a connection to the expression of the melanin concentrating hormone receptor 1 (MCHR1) and was in high linkage disequilibrium (R^2 = 0.76) with another locus associated with increased risk of bipolar disorder.
title: Genome-wide association study of treatment resistant depression highlights shared biology with metabolic traits

finding: This SNP overlapped a neuronal enhancer in the CACNA1I gene body, providing insights into gene regulation related to neurological diseases.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: It also overlapped the neuronal enhancer within the CACNA1I gene, indicating potential importance in neurological disorder mechanisms.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: This SNP was noted for overlapping a neuronal enhancer within the CACNA1I gene body, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: This SNP was located at the solute carrier family 25 member 17 locus (SLC25A17), which was identified as another shared genomic locus among BDI and BDII, with a significant p-value of 7.47×10^-3 in the pleioFDR analysis.
title: Patterns of convergence and divergence between bipolar disorder type I and type II: evidence from integrative genomic analyses

finding: The SNP rs130406 showed a reduced odds of IBS-C with an aOR of 0.68 (95% CI=0.51-0.91), indicating its implications in IBS subtype risk.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs4680 in the COMT gene contributed to the overall DGRS, showing an impact on dopamine neurotransmission that was linked to impulsive behaviors in Parkinson's disease patients. It highlighted that dopamine processing influenced the severity of ICBs in patients on dopamine agonist medication.
title: Performance on the Balloon Analogue Risk Task and Anticipatory Response Inhibition Task is Associated with Severity of Impulse Control Behaviours in People with Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The rs738409 SNP in the PNPLA3 gene was highlighted for its robust association with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). The finding indicated that the G allele of this SNP presented a high frequency in Hispanic populations, which could contribute to the observed higher rates and severity of NAFLD in this ethnic group.
title: Ethnicity-specific alterations of plasma and hepatic lipidomic profiles are related to high NAFLD rate and severity in Hispanic Americans, a pilot study

finding: The SNP rs555607708 was associated with multiple cancer types, specifically breast cancer (OR 4.15), prostate cancer (OR 2.40), and leukemia (OR 8.48). This frameshift variant in the CHEK2 gene had a low effect allele frequency of 0.22%.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: This SNP was significant in the MOOD and AUD analysis at conjFDR and had prior associations with the level of response to alcohol, indicating its relevance as an endophenotype for AUD.
title: Genetic overlap between mood instability and alcohol-related phenotypes suggests shared biological underpinnings

finding: The G1 variant (rs73885319) was associated with chronic kidney disease (CKD) markers, notably high urinary albumin:creatinine ratio (uACR) as measured in 85 individuals with CKD within the cohort.
title: Phenome-wide analysis of APOL1 risk variants reveals associations between one combination of haplotypes and multiple disease phenotypes in addition to chronic kidney disease

finding: The G2 variant (rs71785313) was implicated in CKD related findings, specifically low estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) when assessed with other high-risk variants, suggesting a role in CKD progression.
title: Phenome-wide analysis of APOL1 risk variants reveals associations between one combination of haplotypes and multiple disease phenotypes in addition to chronic kidney disease

finding: The lead cis-splicing SNP rs34495746 was found to predominantly mediate the effects on plasma protein levels of IL17RA through transcript splicing, accounting for 90.41% of the observed variation.
title: Genetic determinants of blood gene expression and splicing and their contribution to molecular phenotypes and health outcomes

finding: The SYN3/TIMP3:rs5754227-T variant was significantly associated with retinal pigment epithelium and Bruch's membrane (RPE+BM) thickening, suggesting an involvement in AMD pathophysiology.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The SNP rs73885319 was associated with increased risk of chronic kidney disease (CKD) in individuals with APOL1 high-risk genotypes. It contributed to the identification of individuals homozygous for the G1 variant, which was part of the two missense variants categorized under the G1 high-risk genotype.
title: Multi-ethnic polygenic risk modifies the association between APOL1 high risk genotypes and chronic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs60910145, together with rs73885319, was linked to the G1 high-risk genotype for kidney disease, demonstrating a significant association with CKD risk in African American and Hispanic American populations.
title: Multi-ethnic polygenic risk modifies the association between APOL1 high risk genotypes and chronic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs12106505 was utilized as a proxy for the G2 high-risk genotype due to its strong linkage with rs71785313 and showed significant associations within the context of polygenic risk scores for CKD.
title: Multi-ethnic polygenic risk modifies the association between APOL1 high risk genotypes and chronic kidney disease

finding: The G1 allele (rs73885319) was associated with a higher risk of COVID-19 hospitalisation (OR=2.1, 95% CI: 1.1-3.8) and death (OR=5.9, 95% CI: 2.2-15.3) in individuals carrying the G1/G2 genotype compared to G0/G0. This indicated that G1 contributed to adverse COVID-19 outcomes among people of African ancestry.
title: Adverse outcomes in SARS-CoV-2 infections are associated with a combination of variant genotypes at two loci in the APOL1 gene: a UK Biobank study

finding: The G2 allele (rs71785313) was implicated in increased COVID-19 risk; those with the G1/G2 genotype had a significantly elevated odds of mortality from COVID-19 (OR=2.7, 95% CI: 1.2-6.4) relative to individuals with G0/G0 genotype. Thus, G2 was also associated with worse outcomes in the context of COVID-19.
title: Adverse outcomes in SARS-CoV-2 infections are associated with a combination of variant genotypes at two loci in the APOL1 gene: a UK Biobank study

finding: This SNP was linked to TMPRSS6, part of the hepcidin production signaling pathway, which regulates iron absorption. The SNP's significance was noted with a p-value of 2.52×10⁻⁵⁰, indicating its foundational role in iron metabolism.
title: Hemochromatosis Neural Archetype Reveals Iron Disruption in Motor Circuits

finding: The SNP rs36062310, which represented a missense variant in KLHDC7B (Val504Met), showed a significant association with hearing loss, indicating that loss of KLHDC7B function increased hearing loss risk.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs769258 was evaluated using the TaqMan DME Genotyping Assays, showing a 100% concordance with benchmark tests. This SNP is notable as it is involved in the metabolism of various drugs including certain antidepressants and opioids.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: Similar to rs769258, rs267608319 was genotyped and also showed a 100% concordance with benchmark methods. This SNP is recognized for its relevance in drug metabolism, affirming the robustness of the Nala PGx Core panel.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The G allele of rs738409 was associated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and was linked to a significant reduction in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) in individuals of white British ancestry from the UK Biobank dataset. This finding suggested a causal relationship where NAFLD, influenced by the rs738409 variant, could lead to kidney function impairment. In contrasted analyses, this association was significant in individuals with a higher probability of developing NAFLD, whereas it became nonsignificant in lower-risk groups.
title: Causal effects from non-alcoholic fatty liver disease on kidney function: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: For SNP rs2413450, associated with TMPRSS6, a p-value of 2.52x10^-50 was recorded, denoting its significant correlation with iron homeostasis. This gene is involved in the signaling pathway that regulates hepcidin, a crucial hormone for iron absorption, thus linking it to iron-related disorders.
title: Neural Archetypes Learnt from Hemochromatosis Reveals Iron Dysregulation in Motor Circuits

finding: The COMT genotype was significantly associated with early-onset preeclampsia (PE) in mothers who possessed the Met158Met genotype compared to the Val158Val or Val158Met genotypes. This association held for both African American and Caucasian populations, suggesting the maternal COMT Met158Met genotype may serve as a risk factor for early-onset PE.
title: The COMT Val158Met Polymorphism is Significantly Associated with Early Onset Preeclampsia in Both African American and Caucasian Mothers

finding: The mEH Tyr61Ser polymorphism (rs2285097) was identified as influencing enzyme activity, which subsequently correlated with increased susceptibility to certain cancers. This finding was significant in the context of how individuals metabolize Propylene Oxide (PO), highlighting the impact of genetics on detoxification processes.
title: Biological Factors Influencing Individual Responses to Propylene Oxide: A Systematic Review of Exogenous Exposure, Endogenous Production and Detoxification

finding: The rs73885316 SNP, which corresponds to the APOL1 p.N264K missense variant, was shown to have a protective effect against the cytotoxicity of the APOL1 G1 and G2 risk alleles when co-inherited. Specifically, this variant reduced the penetrance of high-risk genotypes G1G2 and G2G2, thus categorizing them as low-risk. This finding was significant for understanding APOL1-associated nephropathy and had important clinical implications for managing patients with high-risk genotypes that includes the G2 allele.
title: Strong protective effect of the APOL1 p.N264K variant against G2-associated focal segmental glomerulosclerosis and kidney disease

finding: The rs4819670 SNP at the USP18 locus was identified as a trans-eQTL lead variant that co-localized with a GWAS lead variant for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It was found to be associated with decreased expression of type I interferon response genes and reduced risk of SLE in East Asians, indicating its role in the regulation of interferon signaling.
title: USP18 modulates lupus risk via negative regulation of interferon response

finding: The rs3180408 missense variant in the USP18 gene was linked to decreased USP18 function, known to regulate type I interferon response genes. The rs3180408-T allele was associated with SLE risk, suggesting that it negatively impacted USP18 function despite being predicted as benign by various effect prediction tools, and it was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with the rs4819670 SNP.
title: USP18 modulates lupus risk via negative regulation of interferon response

finding: The variant rs73885319, a G1 allele of the APOL1 gene, was noted for its association with chronic kidney disease (CKD). It was identified as part of the scoring system designed to enhance CKD risk prediction across ancestrally diverse populations, demonstrating its relevance in the polygenic score (GPS) developed to assess CKD risk.
title: Genome-wide polygenic score with APOL1 risk genotypes predicts chronic kidney disease across major continental ancestries

finding: The variant rs60910145, also a part of the APOL1 G1 alleles, contributed positively to the understanding of CKD risk within the context of the GPS that combined both APOL1 genotypes and existing GWAS data on estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR). This SNP represented significant risks when modeling CKD across varied ancestral populations.
title: Genome-wide polygenic score with APOL1 risk genotypes predicts chronic kidney disease across major continental ancestries

finding: The rs71785313 SNP, which represents one of the G2 alleles of the APOL1 gene, was included as a critical component of the GPS used to predict CKD. Its findings illustrated additive effects on CKD risk when assessed alongside polygenic components in African-ancestry cohorts.
title: Genome-wide polygenic score with APOL1 risk genotypes predicts chronic kidney disease across major continental ancestries

finding: The SNP rs855791, which modulates hepcidin levels and is present in about 53% of Europeans as heterozygotes, was included in the risk score for iron homeostasis. The finding indicated that this SNP could play a significant role in regulating iron levels, influencing the overall association of alcohol intake with brain iron deposition.
title: Impact of moderate alcohol consumption on brain iron and cognition: observational and genetic analyses

finding: The SNP rs738409, located in the adiponutrin gene (PNPLA3), was found to be significantly associated with increased white matter hyperintensity (WMH) volume and microbleeds. This association highlighted the gene's relevance to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease and its potential impact on cerebrovascular health. The context of this finding indicated that the SNP not only contributed to WMH development but was also linked to carotid atherosclerosis in some studies, implicating a vascular component in the pathology.
title: Genetic Interplay Between White Matter Hyperintensities and Alzheimer’s Disease: A Brain-Body Perspective

finding: Situated near XKR3, this SNP maintained study wide significance for cognitive measures indicating a neuroprotective effect.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: Neighbors the KIAA1671 gene and was also found to be significant across cognitive phenotypes.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: This intronic SNP within EP300 was associated with neuroprotective effects in later stages of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The COMT rs4680 was shown to influence LNS scores and affected global and nodal metrics of functional network, linking this SNP to cognitive functions in Parkinson's disease.
title: Parkinson’s disease-associated genetic variants synergistically shape brain networks

finding: The SNP rs71186552, also identified as an intronic variant, showed variance effects on serum 25OHD concentrations. Similar to rs28633797, it was associated with variations in platelet and erythrocyte characteristics, suggesting its involvement in vitamin D-related traits.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The rs17000526-A allele in the APOBEC3B region was associated with higher expression of the APOBEC3B gene, contributing to somatic mutagenesis of APOBEC signatures in bladder tumors.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The SNP rs2330634 showed strong evidence of being an eQTL for macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) in 35 tissue types and was also linked to increased bladder cancer risk (OR 1.14, 95% CI 1.05-1.23, q-value=0.072). This association indicated a potential role in cancer risk through the modulation of inflammatory processes.
title: Association between circulating inflammatory markers and adult cancer risk: a Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The rare intronic variant rs577454702 in MAPK1 was associated with significantly increased risk of OC with an OR of 2.60 (95% CI: 1.86, 3.65; p=2.53×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The SNP rs140522 was found in enQTL-colocalized events linking high light scatter reticulocyte count to the TYMP gene, with implications regarding its significance in leukemia.
title: Genetic determinants of gene expression noise and its role in complex trait variation

finding: SNP rs9306356 was identified as a significant variant associated with substance use traits, located in TCF20.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs5750911 was shown to be within TNRC6B and linked to smoking initiation (SMK) associated with novel pathways.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The COMT-Val158Met polymorphism (rs4680) was associated with postpartum depression (PPD) symptoms at 6 weeks postpartum, though this association did not persist at 6 months. This suggests a relevant interaction between this genetic variant and perinatal depression.
title: A sum of its parts: A systematic review evaluating biopsychosocial and behavioral determinants of perinatal depression

finding: The study found that the binding affinity of the [18F]GE-180 TSPO ligand was affected by the co-dominant rs6971 (Ala/Thr) SNP of the TSPO gene, which impacted the imaging analysis of PET scans. The analysis revealed that high-affinity binders (HAB) were Ala/Ala carriers, while low-affinity binders (LAB) were Thr/Thr carriers, with mixed-affinity binders (MAB) being Ala/Thr carriers.
title: MRI connectivity-based spread of microglial activation in early Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The variant rs145598156 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant variant associated with PCOS in the FinnGen study, showing a strong association with an odds ratio (OR) of 3.01 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.005. Additionally, it was tightly linked (r²=0.95) to the protein truncating variant c.1100delC in CHEK2, which was also enriched in the Finnish population.
title: Leveraging Northern European population history; novel low frequency variants for polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The variant rs182075939 was found to be significantly associated with PCOS in the Estonian Biobank with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.69 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.04. It was located 22 kb from the transcription start site of TTC28 and showed a strong linkage (r²=0.83) with a missense variant I157T in CHEK2, which impacts protein binding capabilities.
title: Leveraging Northern European population history; novel low frequency variants for polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The variant rs112424815 showed significant eQTL results with p=6.10e-8 in the putamen for the gene ATG14, indicating it may influence KTN1 expression indirectly.
title: A genetic and transcriptomic assessment of the KTN1 gene in Parkinson’s disease risk

finding: PNPLA3 rs738409 exhibited a significant interaction with BMI on alanine aminotransferase levels, confirming a previously verified gene-environment interaction.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: PNPLA3 rs3747207 was involved in interactions affecting aspartate aminotransferase (AST), corroborating earlier investigated effects.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The rs4819670 lead variant at the USP18 locus was confirmed to be identical to a GWAS lead variant reported for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in East Asians. It colocalized with the SLE signal with a posterior probability of 0.97, and the rs4819670-C allele was associated with decreased expression of multiple type I interferon response genes and a reduced risk of SLE.
title: Trans-eQTL mapping prioritises USP18 as a negative regulator of interferon response at a lupus risk locus

finding: The missense variant rs3180408, located in the USP18 gene, was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs4819670. While it was not associated with a significant cis-eQTL effect, it was implicated as the most likely causal variant affecting the USP18 gene's function in izs negative regulation of interferon signalling, despite predictions suggesting it might be benign.
title: Trans-eQTL mapping prioritises USP18 as a negative regulator of interferon response at a lupus risk locus

finding: The SNP rs738409 in the PNPLA3 gene was identified as a widely validated genetic risk factor for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). It was associated with alterations in triglyceride (TAG) hydrolysis and increased severity of NAFLD.
title: Quantitative genome-scale analysis of human liver reveals dysregulation of glycosphingolipid pathways in progressive nonalcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The rs6971 SNP was associated with varying TSPO radioligand binding affinities, which impacted the results of PET imaging in Parkinson's disease (PD) subjects. The study indicated that the difference in TSPO binding between control and PD participants was predominantly influenced by subjects with high affinity binding (HAB). Analysis revealed that the mean TSPO binding signal in moderate affinity binding (MAB) subjects did not significantly differ from controls, indicating that TSPO imaging is more beneficial for HAB individuals. This finding underscores the importance of TSPO genotype on PET imaging outcomes in PD.
title: Brain and systemic inflammation in de novo Parkinson’s disease

finding: In the study, it was found that homozygous carriers of the PNPLA3 rs738409 variant had an increased risk of cancer incidence, with a hazard ratio of 1.27 (1.02-1.58, p = 3.1×10⁻²). This association was consistent across cohorts GoDARTS and SHARE. Furthermore, rs738409 was also linked to increased MDLD (OR = 1.23(1.12-1.36), p < 0.0001) and indicated a potential causative role in the relationship between MDLD and cancer. The presence of this SNP highlighted the correlation between NAFLD and cancer risk.
title: Metabolic Dysfunction Related Liver Disease as a Risk Factor for Cancer

finding: The germline variant rs1014971 was associated with increased expression of the gene APOBEC3B, which related to bladder cancer risk. In BKPyV-positive tumors, the highest average expression of APOBEC3B was observed, especially in tumors harboring both BKPyV and two copies of rs1014971. This indicated a potential interaction between this SNP and viral presence that may contribute to the tumor's biological characteristics.
title: Common Mechanisms of Virus-Mediated Oncogenesis in Bladder Cancers Arising In Solid Organ Transplant Recipients

finding: In the GOCAR cohort, the presence of the G1 allele (rs73885319) in recipients was associated with an increased risk of death-censored allograft loss (DCAL), indicated by a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.14 (P = 0.006), independent of genetic ancestry.
title: Recipient APOL1 risk alleles associate with death-censored renal allograft survival and rejection episodes

finding: Similar to rs73885319, the G1 allele (rs60910145) in recipients correlated with a heightened risk of death-censored allograft loss (DCAL) in the GOCAR cohort, with an HR of 2.14 (P = 0.006). This SNP exhibited nearly perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs73885319.
title: Recipient APOL1 risk alleles associate with death-censored renal allograft survival and rejection episodes

finding: In the CTOT cohort, the G2 allele denoted by rs71785313 was directly genotyped and its presence also correlated with increased risk of TCMR events, reinforcing the immunomodulatory implications of APOL1 risk alleles in transplant recipients.
title: Recipient APOL1 risk alleles associate with death-censored renal allograft survival and rejection episodes

finding: The BRD1 gene variant rs763236 associated with DNA methylation was found to be 33.7 times more frequent in UKB-AFR (0.363) than in UKB-EUR (0.011), marking a significant discovery.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The rs6971 SNP was analyzed in a cohort consisting of patients with 4 repeat tauopathies (4RTs), AD-CBS, typical Alzheimer's disease (AD), and healthy controls. A significant group difference for rs6971 SNP status was identified, suggesting a relationship between the SNP status and the groups' neuropsychological performance, specifically shown through the MoCA scores. Additionally, the distribution of medium and high affinity binders (MAB and HAB) varied among the groups, indicating its potential significance in tau pathology and microglial activation.
title: Individual regional associations between Aβ-, tau- and neurodegeneration (ATN) with microglial activation in patients with primary and secondary tauopathies

finding: The SNP rs1473811, found on chromosome 22, was a novel identifier connected with EXT traits, particularly associated with aspects of chronotype and schizophrenia.
title: Genetic Insights into Externalizing and Internalizing Traits through Integration of the Research Domain Criteria and Hierarchical Taxonomy of Psychopathology

finding: The rs738409 variant (Ile148Met) in the PNPLA3 gene was identified as a predisposing risk factor for the development of Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) in the ethnic Bengali population of West Bengal. The analysis showed statistically significant differences in genotype and allele frequencies between NAFLD cases and controls (P = 0.001 and P = 0.0057). Specifically, the 'GG' genotype and the 'G' allele were associated with higher FIB-4 and Controlled Attenuation Parameter (CAP) scores, suggesting an increased severity of hepatic steatosis among carriers. In NAFLD patients with the CC genotype, higher levels of total bilirubin were observed (P = 0.0189). Overall, the findings confirmed the role of the rs738409 variant in susceptibility to NAFLD and its severity in the Bengali cohort.
title: Association of the rs738409 polymorphism in PNPLA3 with development and severity of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in ethnic Bengali population of West Bengal

finding: The SNP rs2413667 was linked to the odds of missingness of the metabolite solanidine. It was also an eQTL for CYP2D6, which plays a significant role in drug metabolism and was identified as a potential pharmacogenomic marker.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs147678157 was associated with a meat dietary pattern, showing a significant interaction with HbA1c levels. The association was particularly strong, with p-values between 1×10⁻⁶ and 1×10⁻³ for multiple meat consumption traits, highlighting its importance in glycemic control.
title: Genome-wide gene-diet interaction analysis in the UK Biobank identifies novel effects on Hemoglobin A1c
