finding: The rs140270534 variant showed an interaction with dried fruit consumption and functioned as an eQTL for the gene XKR3 in whole blood. This interaction suggested that dietary intake influenced HbA1c levels, although the specific mechanism remained unclear.
title: Genome-wide gene-diet interaction analysis in the UK Biobank identifies novel effects on Hemoglobin A1c

finding: In a study of the rs738409 variant in the PNPLA3/adiponutrin gene, the G allele (n=96) versus CC homozygotes (n=104) was associated with higher levels of liver enzymes AST, ALT, and GGT. Additionally, the G allele was linked to lower fasting insulin levels, reduced insulin resistance, and a decreased incidence of large for gestational age (LGA) births.
title: Refining the diagnosis of Gestational Diabetes Mellitus: A systematic review to inform efforts in precision medicine

finding: The SNP rs73885319 was part of the APOL1 G1 variant associated with an increased risk of sepsis among Black patients. The study indicated that high-risk APOL1 genotypes, including those defined by this SNP, conferred an increased risk of developing renal dysfunction related to sepsis, though this association was dependent on pre-existing severe renal disease.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and the occurrence of sepsis in patients hospitalized with infections

finding: Similar to rs73885319, rs60910145 was part of the APOL1 G1 variant and contributed to a significant association with increased susceptibility to sepsis in Black patients. This finding highlighted the role of APOL1 high-risk genotypes, which include this SNP, in the context of sepsis-related renal dysfunction, further influenced by pre-existing renal conditions.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and the occurrence of sepsis in patients hospitalized with infections

finding: The SNP rs71785313 corresponded to the APOL1 G2 variant. This SNP was involved in the research showing a correlation with sepsis risk, particularly through its association with renal dysfunction in the studied Black patient population. However, like other APOL1 variants, its impact was moderated by the presence of severe renal disease.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and the occurrence of sepsis in patients hospitalized with infections

finding: The SNP rs12106505 served as a proxy for the G2 allele (rs71785313) in the analysis of APOL1 variants. As with other high-risk alleles, it demonstrated an association with sepsis risk and renal dysfunction, although its significance was similarly affected when considering existing severe renal conditions in patients.
title: Association between APOL1 risk variants and the occurrence of sepsis in patients hospitalized with infections

finding: The frameshift deletion in CHEK2 was linked to increased risk of myeloproliferative neoplasms and lymphoid leukaemia, demonstrating significant associations with blood cancer traits.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: Ranked by GWAS and included in analyses, rs383306 provided insights into genetic risk factors for hypertension.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: This SNP correlates with the missingness of solanidine, acting as an eQTL for CYP2D6, a critical enzyme for drug metabolism. Its association with solanidine suggests it may function as a pharmacogenomic marker for identifying metabolic efficiency.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs2232088, which represented a homozygous p.R169W variant in the MIEF1 gene, was identified in the discovery cohort as potentially deleterious. This variant was prioritized based on its association with early-onset Parkinson's disease (EOPD) through increased frequency observation in EOPD cases.
title: DEFINING CANDIDATE PARKINSON’S DISEASE GENES THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF GENOME-WIDE HOMOZYGOSITY

finding: The SNP rs62231080 was identified as part of a genome-wide significant locus on chromosome 22. It was linked to within-individual variability in body mass index (BMI) and mapped to the genes NUP50, FAM18A, and RIBC2. This locus indicated that genetic factors could influence variability in HD-related phenotypes.
title: Clinical and genetic association studies reveal within-individual variability as an integral part of Huntington disease

finding: The rs228914 variant at TMPRSS6 did not reach significance in the current study; however, it was reported directionally consistent with previously noted associations with RBC parameters, implicating the gene's role in iron homeostasis.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The analysis of the genotype at the RS6971 polymorphism in the Translocator Protein (TSPO) gene indicated that both long COVID patients were C/C genotype, categorizing them as high affinity binders of the PET tracer [<sup>18</sup>F]DPA-714. This finding was significant as it correlated with the observed widespread neuroinflammation in the patients.
title: Long COVID is associated with extensive in-vivo neuroinflammation on [18F]DPA-714 PET

finding: The rs738409 variant in the PNPLA3 gene was linked to increased risk of metabolic-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD) in normal-weight individuals. Carriers of the GG genotype demonstrated the highest risk for MASLD compared to individuals with overweight or obesity, reflecting a significant association with hepatic fat accumulation.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: The rs738408 SNP in the PNPLA3 gene exhibited the most significant association (p = 5.4E-30) with MASLD, reinforcing its established role in hepatic fat accumulation.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: The exonic SNP rs1007863, situated in the 22q13.31 region, was associated with significant eQTLs in various tissues including visceral adipose and blood, which indicated its potential relevance in the context of metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease (MAFLD) and atrial fibrillation (AF). This strengthens the understanding of its role within the shared genetic architecture of these conditions.
title: Genome-wide insights into the shared genetic landscape between metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The G-allele of SNP rs738409 within the PNPLA3 gene was linked to a reduced risk of CAD, showing that it may modulate triglyceride metabolism in the liver thereby impacting cardiovascular outcomes in individuals with MAFLD.
title: Genome-wide insights into the shared genetic landscape between metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and cardiovascular diseases

finding: This variant, located near ADORA2A, was also implicated in coffee intake, with prior associations linking it to caffeine intake from both tea and coffee.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of Coffee Intake in UK/US Participants of European Ancestry Uncover Gene-Cohort Influences

finding: The SNP <italic>PNPLA3</italic> rs738409, specifically the GG homozygous variant, was found to be associated with an increased risk of liver fibrosis. This genetic marker was linked to a further elevation in risk of hospitalization or death from heart failure, particularly when correlated with high liver fibrosis scores determined by non-invasive tests, signifying its importance in individuals with chronic liver disease.
title: Liver fibrosis assessed using non-invasive markers and genetic polymorphisms (PNPLA3 and TM6SF2) predisposing to liver fibrosis, is associated with hospitalization or death from heart failure: a prospective UK Biobank study

finding: This SNP was confirmed to be associated with pancreatic cancer, indicating consistent findings with earlier research.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs77968014-G, located in the gene <italic>SLC16A8</italic>, was reported to be associated with deficits in transepithelial lactate transport in iPSC-RPE cells derived from patients carrying this risk allele. Furthermore, the research highlighted a progressive loss of MCT3 with increasing severity of dry AMD, supporting the relevance of this SNP in AMD pathophysiology.
title: Transcriptomic changes predict metabolic alterations in LC3 associated phagocytosis in aged mice

finding: The rs738409 polymorphism in the PNPLA3 gene was identified as the strongest known genetic risk factor for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD). This nonsynonymous variant resulted in an isoleucine-to-methionine substitution at position 148 (PNPLA3-I148M), which increased both the risk and severity of liver disease manifestations.
title: The fatty liver disease-causing protein PNPLA3-I148M alters lipid droplet-Golgi dynamics

finding: The SNP rs78578513 was associated with microbiota composition and almost reached genome-wide significance (P = 5.0 x 10^-8), indicating its potential role in colorectal cancer risk through influencing microbiota diversity.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: Similar to rs78578513, SNP rs5994535 was identified as having an association that approached genome-wide significance (P = 5.0 x 10^-8), contributing to microbiota variations potentially linked to colorectal cancer.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: The SNP rs3747093 was shown to alter the DNaseI footprint of SCL/TAL in erythroid cells, indicating that it could affect transcription factor binding. Significant allelic skew was observed in erythroid SCL/TAL ChIP-seq data.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The SNP rs855791 was identified as a missense variant in TMPRSS6, affecting iron homeostasis and influencing red blood cell phenotypes. Its roles in liver function and hepcidin regulation were highlighted.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The common missense variant Ile148Met in PNPLA3 was associated with a significant increase in ALT (2.2%) and AST (1.3%), which have been linked to heightened liver disease risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: This SNP showed a strong association (log10(p-gain) = 1115.5) with the ratio of COMT / ITGB1BP2. Although ITGB1BP2 had only a few trans-pQTLs, the ratio analysis indicated complex relationships between these proteins.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: Linked with the BCR protein in a rQTL, rs713617 presented as a cis-rQTL in the analysis, adding support to the associated function of NFATC1 with protein interaction networks.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: The rs6971 polymorphism in the TSPO gene, which resulted in the A147T substitution, was found to significantly reduce ligand binding affinities, impeding the use of TSPO radio-labelled ligands as active biomarkers for inflammation through PET imaging. Additionally, this polymorphism was associated with neurological diseases like bipolar disorder, indicating its functional relevance in the context of mitochondrial protein interactions.
title: Differential mitochondrial protein interaction profile between human translocator protein and its A147T polymorphism variant

finding: SNP rs134620 was found to be associated with the expression of KREMEN1, as well as distal interacting genes RHBDD3 and EWSR1, illustrating its role as a haQTL within the same TAD.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: This SNP was correlated with the expression of the distal gene NIPSNAP1, also located within the same TAD, confirming its role as a haQTL.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: Like rs713657, this SNP was also correlated to the expression of the NIPSNAP1 gene, thus serving as a haQTL within the same chromatin domain.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The SNP rs139883 in the SOX10 gene was associated with the age of onset of schizophrenia in a Han Chinese population, suggesting its relevance in the clinical presentation of SZ.
title: SOX10 Expression Levels may be a Critical Mediator of White Matter Dysfunction in Schizophrenia

finding: The study identified SNP rs35898507, located within the upstream open reading frame (uORF) of A3F mRNA. This SNP was associated with a common variant that induced an amino acid change from Glycine (G) to Valine (V) in the uORF. The G allele was noted to be the ancestral allele, present at over 96% in the population. However, it was concluded that this SNP did not impact the function of the uORF significantly, as no variants with a Minor Allele Frequency (MAF) higher than 0.005 that would dramatically affect the uORF of A3G or A3F were found.
title: A conserved uORF impacts APOBEC3G translation and is essential for translational inhibition by the HIV-1 Vif protein

finding: For rs2069235, which is associated with SLE and rheumatoid arthritis, it was reported that the 'A' allele showed stronger enhancer activity compared to the 'G' allele in EBV-infected B cells, illustrating a potential causal role in SLE risk mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The SNP rs4680 of the catechol-O-methyltransferase (COMT) gene was included in the identified risk combinations for L-TRS. It was reported that individuals with the Met(-) allele may exhibit higher COMT activity, which correlates with schizophrenia pathophysiology and dopamine metabolism.
title: Genetic combination risk for schizophrenia

finding: Identified as part of the MED15 gene, this SNP (22AM1) yielded a genome-wide significant association for age at TFC6 (p=5.0E-09), yet did not show significant association with age at motor onset (p=7.7E-02).
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This marker indicated a genome-wide significant modifier effect (22BM1) in the TMSq75 analysis with a p-value of 2.3E-08.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: SNP rs738409 in PNPLA3 was found associated with NAFLD and corroborated findings regarding liver fat, reflecting its established connection to hepatic steatosis.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs77601382 passed the genome-wide significance threshold with a p-value of 4.64e-8. It was located within a region that overlaps the 3’ end of the <italic>FBLN1</italic> gene, which was associated with nonverbal reasoning, a cognitive phenotype notable for its implications in psychotic disorders.
title: Genetics and Pathway Analysis of Normative Cognitive Variation in the Philadelphia Neurodevelopmental Cohort

finding: The SNP rs74825248 also passed the genome-wide significance threshold with a similar p-value of 4.64e-8. This variant was found in the same significant region associated with nonverbal reasoning and the <italic>FBLN1</italic> gene, linking it to cognitive abilities relevant to psychotic conditions.
title: Genetics and Pathway Analysis of Normative Cognitive Variation in the Philadelphia Neurodevelopmental Cohort

finding: The SNP rs5765534 met the criteria for genome-wide significance (p=4.6×10^-8) and was correlated with performance in nonverbal reasoning. This finding highlighted the role of <italic>FBLN1</italic> in neurodevelopment and psychotic disorders through its association with cognitive testing.
title: Genetics and Pathway Analysis of Normative Cognitive Variation in the Philadelphia Neurodevelopmental Cohort

finding: The variant rs1936950 was shown to be in near perfect linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs1936951 and was fine-mapped (PIP = 0.64) for changes in expression of the ESS2 gene, associated with developmental disorders such as DiGeorge Syndrome. The activating allele significantly increased transcription over baseline with a Δ log2 activity of 0.51.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: Similar to rs1936950, rs1936951 was fine-mapped (PIP = 0.36) for changes in ESS2 expression in the cerebral hemisphere. Its activating allele exhibited a Δ log2 activity of 1.41, and together with rs1936950, the combined effect was a Δ log2 activity of 2.54, indicating the presence of causal variants working synergistically.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The variant rs77968014-G in the SLC16A8 gene was associated with deficits in transepithelial lactate transport in iPSC-RPE cells derived from a patient carrying this risk allele. This research highlighted a potential mechanistic pathway by which this SNP could contribute to AMD pathogenesis, particularly concerning metabolic handling in retinal pigment epithelial cells.
title: Transcriptomic changes predict metabolic alterations in LC3 associated phagocytosis in aged mice

finding: The finding related to the rs35742686 variant, which is a deletion polymorphism (2549delA), indicated a potential influence of CYP2D6 activity on attentional processes linked to cortical activation in spatial tasks.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The rs1065852 SNP (100C>T) was associated with variations in CYP2D6 enzymatic activity levels that correlated positively with cortical activity in areas related to attention.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The rs3892097 variant (1846G>A) showed a positive association with higher enzymatic activity, positively affecting cognitive processes during attentional tasks.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The presence of the rs5030655 SNP (1707delT) was positively correlated with poor metabolizer status and thus linked to increased activity in neural substrates during attentional tasks.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The rs28371725 variant (2988G>A) was found to be critical in determining differences in CYP2D6 activity, with implications for cognitive efficiency in attentional task performance.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: rs1004763 was found to have significant associations with white matter microstructure, impacting FA measures extensively.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: rs2267161 was identified as a significant variant related to white matter microstructure, particularly affecting mean parameters of AD.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The variant rs201455670 was identified in the L1-5219 locus of patient EOC737, where it led to a change of threonine to proline at the 655th position of the L1 ORF2p protein. This alteration was significant as it affected the reverse transcriptase domain necessary for L1 retrotransposition, potentially rendering the L1-5219 incompetent for retrotransposition. Additionally, a mutagenesis study indicated that this specific amino acid change reduced retrotransposition efficiency by nearly 90%. The variant was also found in the Kuramochi cell line homozygously, which did not show somatic L1-insertions. This finding contributed to understanding the dynamics of L1 activity in high-grade serous ovarian cancer.
title: L1 retrotransposition is regulated post-transcriptionally In High-Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer

finding: In the context of glioblastoma, the study led by Kim et al. identified rs6010376 as significant in relation to STAT3 activation, which is implicated in the biochemical and therapeutic implications for the disease. High levels of STAT3 activity were correlated with more aggressive tumor behavior and poor clinical outcomes in glioblastoma patients, indicating that rs6010376 could be an important genetic factor influencing glioblastoma progression.
title: The mechanoreceptor PIEZO1 is a novel oncogene in glioma by promoting astrocyte reactivity

finding: The SNP rs4819554 was associated with early-onset coronary artery disease, indicating its potential role in CAD predisposition as reported in a study analyzing the total leukocyte transcript.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs138880 was associated with the methylation analysis of BRD1 promoter regions in the context of schizophrenia. This indicated that rs138880 could play a significant role in the epigenetic modulation related to schizophrenia susceptibility.
title: Identification of DNA motifs that regulate DNA methylation

finding: The SNP rs41276317 was part of a cross-gene epistasis with rs3130614 (involving MICB and TOB2), showing significant statistical association with the phenotype.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The rs1547014:T>C variant in the intron of the CHEK2 gene was associated with MASLD, with carriers of the C allele displaying decreased expression of CHEK2. This variant was identified as an eQTL for liver tissue and contributed to the understanding of the genetic regulation of liver function in MASLD.
title: Identification of genes conferring individual-level variation responsible for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis using single-cell eQTL analysis

finding: There was an indication of increased intron retention linked to this SNP, although specific expression patterns were not detailed.
title: Expression changes confirm genomic variants predicted to result in allele-specific, alternative mRNA splicing

finding: This SNP exhibited notable changes in splice isoform levels driven by its impact on the natural splice site strength, where decreased splice site strength led to higher rates of exon skipping.
title: Expression changes confirm genomic variants predicted to result in allele-specific, alternative mRNA splicing

finding: This SNP created an exonic hnRNP A1 site affecting exon definition and increasing exon skipping.
title: Expression changes confirm genomic variants predicted to result in allele-specific, alternative mRNA splicing

finding: This SNP was associated with the activation of a cryptic splice site located downstream, confirmed by RNAseq analysis.
title: Expression changes confirm genomic variants predicted to result in allele-specific, alternative mRNA splicing

finding: The SNP rs12628403 served as a proxy for the APOBEC3B deletion, and it was validated through genomic analyses showing associations with decreased levels of APOBEC3B expression in both tumor and adjacent normal tissue. In the Hong Kong Breast Cancer (HKBC) cohort, the frequency of the rs12628403-C allele was found to be 44.7% among 76 luminal breast cancer patients. However, high TIL patients did not show a significant difference in the frequency of the deletion allele compared to other luminal immune subtypes. Furthermore, the expression level of the hybrid transcript APOBEC3A_B, resulting from the APOBEC3B deletion, did not vary meaningfully across different luminal immune subtypes. Various statistical analyses indicated no significant variation in ESTIMATE immune scores based on different genotypes of SNP rs12628403.
title: Immune gene expression profiling reveals heterogeneity in luminal breast tumors

finding: The SNP rs738409 in PNPLA3 was associated with liver fat, yielding a p-value of 8e-134 and a beta of 0.229. This SNP has also been linked to NAFLD.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs855791 in TMPRSS6 was associated with a p-value of 2.0e-31 and a beta of 0.09, contributing to iron metabolism understanding.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: This SNP was associated with reduced SA in ASD, reinforcing its implications for brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP showed associations with increased SA in BD, establishing its role in anatomical features.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs4147638 was found to have overlapping co-eGenes with rs1131017–RPS26, indicating potential common upstream regulatory pathways. This suggests that both SNPs may influence similar biological functions in immune responses.
title: Identification of genetic variants that impact gene co-expression relationships using large-scale single-cell data

finding: The common missense variant rs738409 (Ile148Met) in PNPLA3 demonstrated a strong association with an increase of 2.2% in ALT and 1.3% in AST, known to significantly increase liver disease risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The SNP rs16947 in CYP2D6 (2851C>T) was noted for its high frequency (0.3 - 0.4) and its significant functional consequence was highlighted as it led to a largely decreased turnover rate of the enzyme, which is crucial for drug metabolism.
title: Non-additivity of the functional properties of individual P450 species and its manifestation in the effects of alcohol consumption on the metabolism of ketamine and amitriptyline

finding: The SNP rs1065852 in CYP2D6 (100C>T) also had a high frequency (-0.2) and was associated with pronounced functional consequences, resulting in a largely decreased turnover rate which affects the metabolism of certain drugs.
title: Non-additivity of the functional properties of individual P450 species and its manifestation in the effects of alcohol consumption on the metabolism of ketamine and amitriptyline

finding: This SNP had genome-wide significant associations with T central memory and CD8 T cell signatures in the immune landscape.
title: Germline genetic contribution to the immune landscape of cancer

finding: This SNP was associated with CD8 T-cells LSES and showed a significant correlation with immune response traits.
title: Germline genetic contribution to the immune landscape of cancer

finding: The LOY-associated variant rs186430430, a loss-of-function variant in CHEK2, was correlated with a 2.3-fold increased risk of breast cancer, illustrating its role as a genetic determinant in both LOY and cancer susceptibility.
title: Genetic predisposition to mosaic Y chromosome loss in blood is associated with genomic instability in other tissues and susceptibility to non-haematological cancers

finding: The study indicated that the rs7291467 polymorphism had a significant influence on the expression of Galectin-2. It was established that Galectin-2 acted as an inhibitor of arteriogenesis, linking this SNP to cardiovascular phenotypes. This finding was particularly relevant as it highlighted the genetic basis driving arteriogenesis related to heart health.
title: Natural genetic variation quantitatively regulates heart-rate and -dimension

finding: The rs738409 polymorphism in the PNPLA3 gene was associated with liver damage and the development of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), illustrating its significance in the context of fatty liver disease progression.
title: Modeling alcoholic liver disease in a human Liver-Chip

finding: Showed strong associations with LDL and total cholesterol, indicating its pivotal role in cholesterol metabolism.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The common missense variant Ile148Met (rs738409) in PNPLA3 was associated with a 2.2% increase in ALT and a 1.3% increase in AST, known for its strong link to liver disease risks.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: At the ZNRF3 locus, signal 1 (rs2294239) was colocalized with GWAS signals and was reported as a significant eQTL, indicating a positive original finding.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: At the ZNRF3 locus, signal 2 (rs5762906) was also colocalized with GWAS signals and represented a positive original finding.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs6971 was associated with differential binding affinities of TSPO ligands, which categorized individuals into low-affinity binding status (LAB), medium-affinity binding status (MAB), and high-affinity binding status (HAB). This polymorphism was identified as significant in the context of glioblastoma, correlating with tspos' role in tumor cell radiotracer uptake as demonstrated in studies noted in Berroterán-Infante et al. (2019), thereby highlighting its relevance in the diagnosis and understanding of glioblastoma pathology.
title: Deciphering sources of PET signals in the tumor microenvironment of glioblastoma at cellular resolution

finding: This SNP was linked to the monocyte count and was associated with IL17RA expression in brain cortex and several other brain tissues, revealing its potential involvement in immune-related traits.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: The variant rs7288455 was linked to increased expression levels of the gene CACNA1I across all cell populations, with significant increases observed particularly in Sst Chodl cells. The reference A allele was predicted to decrease expression, while mutations to C or G were shown to enhance expression. Importantly, rs7288455 overlapped with an ENCODE candidate cis-regulatory element, supporting its role in gene regulation.
title: Predicting cell population-specific gene expression from genomic sequence

finding: The SNP rs1061325 was identified as having a significant relationship with dietary changes influencing the functional dynamics of CHC22 clathrin, particularly involving a methionine to valine substitution at position 1316 (M1316V). The allele encoding valine (V1316) was found to be associated with less effective GLUT4 membrane traffic regulation and a potentially attenuated insulin response in human populations adapted to farming diets. Notably, this SNP showed a global frequency of 77% in modern human populations, indicating strong balancing selection and a notable excess of heterozygosity in several European populations.
title: Genetic diversity of CHC22 clathrin impacts its function in glucose metabolism

finding: This SNP in PNPLA3 was associated with liver fat, corroborating previous associations with NAFLD.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This intronic variant was part of the P1 blood group phenotype inference, albeit associated with lower concordance.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: This variant was noted in the P1 blood group investigation with high concordance for P1 antigen expression.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant was evaluated in association with the P1 blood group phenotypes, with overall good concordance.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: This SNP was also assessed within the context of the P1 blood group, contributing to phenotype inference accuracy.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The SNP rs714024 was found to be significantly differentially imbalanced for chromatin activity and associated expression of the GRAMD4 gene in tumors. It acted as a highly significant eQTL specifically in tumor samples, suggesting its role as a germline risk variant in renal cell carcinoma (RCC). This finding indicated that despite not being identified in the RCC GWAS, rs714024 has crucial implications for tumor biology and GRAMD4's role in apoptosis.
title: Allelic imbalance reveals widespread germline-somatic regulatory differences and prioritizes risk loci in Renal Cell Carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs1210282, which corresponds to the XPO1 E571K mutation, was investigated for its impact on exportin 1 localization and interactome in B-cell lymphoma. This modification was reported to alter the protein's functionality and potentially affect cellular transport processes related to nuclear transport mechanisms.
title: Protein-protein docking analysis reveals efficient binding and complex formation between the human nuclear transport proteins

finding: The SNP rs77601382 was significantly associated with nonverbal reasoning, achieving a genome-wide significance level (p=4.6×10⁻⁸). This association was located within a 33kb region overlapping the 3' end of the FBLN1 gene, which is linked to fetal neurodevelopment and psychotic disorders.
title: Genetics and Pathway Analysis of Normative Cognitive Variation in the Philadelphia Neurodevelopmental Cohort

finding: The SNP rs74825248 also passed the genome-wide significance threshold (p=4.64e-8) and was associated with nonverbal reasoning. Its significance aligned with the findings at the FBLN1 gene region.
title: Genetics and Pathway Analysis of Normative Cognitive Variation in the Philadelphia Neurodevelopmental Cohort

finding: The SNP rs5765534 was associated with nonverbal reasoning, achieving genome-wide significance (p=4.6×10⁻⁸). Its location was within the significant region of the FBLN1 gene, further supporting the link between this gene and cognitive performance.
title: Genetics and Pathway Analysis of Normative Cognitive Variation in the Philadelphia Neurodevelopmental Cohort

finding: The SNP rs738409 exhibited a significant association with liver fat (p=8e-134, beta=0.229) and has prior research connecting it to NAFLD and metabolic traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs855791 had an significant association (p=2.0e-31, beta=0.09) with a role in iron regulation.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs760294168 corresponds to a pathogenic variant in the mtFAS gene MCAT, specifically c.812T>C; p.T271I. This variant was associated with perturbed electron transport chain (ETC) complex assembly and impaired cellular respiration. It served to illustrate the importance of proper mitochondrial function and related cellular processes.
title: Mitochondrial Phosphopantetheinylation is Required for Oxidative Function

finding: The I148M variant, encoded by rs738409, was strongly associated with an increased susceptibility to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in humans. The study highlighted that the loss-of-function of this variant contributed to the development of hepatic steatosis, contrasting the physiological role of the wild-type PNPLA3 in maintaining hepatic VLDL-TG secretion.
title: Substrate-Specific Function of PNPLA3 Facilitates Hepatic VLDL-Triglyceride Secretion During Stimulated Lipogenesis

finding: SNP rs35928604 associated with the PARVB gene, which showed overexpression in colorectal cancer cases, linking it to potential microbial interactions.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: The variant rs738409 in the PNPLA3 gene was found to be significantly associated with the regulation of gut microbiota and its alterations due to various chemotherapy agents, as indicated by the network established between chemotherapy-induced microbiota changes and the NODs/RIP2/NF-κB signaling pathway. In the context of the study, this SNP contributed to understanding the complex interactions between genetics, gut microbiota, and chemotherapy effects on intestinal health.
title: Chemotherapy drugs induce different gut microbiota disorder pattern and NODs/RIP2/NF-κB signaling pathway activation that lead to different degrees of intestinal injury

finding: The SNP rs738409 at the PNPLA3 locus was associated with the risk of developing non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), a precursor to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). In the studied group, participants exhibited similar frequencies of the risk allele, indicating its relevance in NAFLD and NASH susceptibility.
title: Super-enhancer signature reveals key mechanisms associated with resistance to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis in humans with obesity

finding: The study indicated that the rs738409 SNP at the PNPLA3 locus (Ile148Met variant) was associated with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), which frequently co-occurred with metabolic disorders like obesity and type 2 diabetes. It was reported that this genetic variant served as a risk allele among subjects, including both NASH-prone (NP) and NASH-resistant (NR) individuals, suggesting its contributory role in the progression of liver disease.
title: Liver enhancer signature and regulatory network of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis resistance in humans with obesity

finding: The rs7291467 SNP was identified as a significant polymorphism that influenced the expression of Galectin-2. This finding indicated a role for Galectin-2 as an inhibitor of arteriogenesis, which is critical in the context of cardiac function and vascular development. Thus, the study provided evidence of how genetic variation at this locus may contribute to heart disease mechanisms.
title: Natural genetic variation quantitatively regulates heart rate and dimension

finding: The SNP rs5760147 was identified as the lead SNP for the eQTL at GSTT1, which showed significant association with geographic atrophy-related gene expression in multiple RPE subpopulations.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: In the progenitor RPE subpopulation, rs6003988 was identified as the lead SNP associated with the eQTL for GSTT1.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: In RPE6, the SNP rs2097433 served as the lead SNP for GSTT1-related eQTL, demonstrating a specific association within this subpopulation.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs5765545 on chromosome 22 was associated with the planum temporale regarding regional grey matter volume.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: This SNP corresponds to rs519400784, demonstrating a strong functional relevance in cattle, classified as Category 1d, and indicating significant effects on gene regulation.
title: Annotation and assessment of functional variants in regulatory regions using epigenomic data in farm animals

finding: This variant was identified as having an interaction with the genotype and stage for DDTL, suggesting that this eQTL was specific to iPSC-CVPC samples.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The rs5764238 variant was shown to have a significant allelic effect on SPI1 binding in a binding quantitative trait locus (bQTL) study. It was predicted that the G allele increases SPI1 ChIP-seq and ATAC-seq signal by creating a strong SPI1 motif, as visualized using the dynseq track in BPNet models of SPI1 ChIP-seq and ATAC-seq data.
title: The dynseq genome browser track enables visualization of context-specific, dynamic DNA sequence features at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The study found that carriers of the A-allele for COMT A/G rs4680 exhibited significantly higher levels of physical activity (PA) compared to non-carriers, particularly among those whose main PA was running. The prevalence of A-allele carriers was significantly higher in highly active participants (83%) compared to those with moderate (64%) and low (47%) activity levels. This suggests a strong association between the A-allele of rs4680 and increased engagement in sport activities, particularly running, with the implication that the A-allele might be linked to heightened sensitivity to the rewards of physical activity.
title: The association of catechol-O-methyltransferase genetic polymorphism rs4680 in physical activity among adult women

finding: The SNP rs4680 in COMT was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) and is currently discussed as a target for AD treatment. COMT is also known to be the target of Tolcapone, an anti-Parkinson drug, illustrating the potential for target repositioning identified by the GuiltyTargets method.
title: GuiltyTargets: Prioritization of Novel Therapeutic Targets with Deep Network Representation Learning

finding: The rs397514502 SNP was identified as a mutation (c.631C>G) leading to a p.Q211E substitution in the A4GALT gene. This mutation resulted in a rare enzyme variant known as A4Gmut, which altered the enzymatic function by allowing the transfer of galactose to GalNAc-terminating glycosphingolipids. This finding indicated that the presence of the variant could affect the synthesis of specific glycosphingolipids (NOR, NOR1, and NOR2) and was relevant in the context of the P1PK histo-blood group system.
title: B4GALT5-deficient CHO-Lec2 cells expressing human α1,4-galactosyltransferase: a glycoengineered cell model for studying Shiga toxin receptors

finding: The SNP rs909685, located in the intron of the SYNGR1 gene, was associated with increased susceptibility to rheumatoid arthritis (RA) across multiple ancestries. It influenced the expression of SYNGR1 and was linked to the methylation of a nearby CpG site (cg19713460). The association showed that as NK cell and T cell proportions increased, the expression levels of SYNGR1 augmented, whereas higher monocyte proportions correlated with decreased expression. This SNP's action suggested a mechanism by which it may affect RA risk via NK cell-specific pathways.
title: Interaction molecular QTL mapping discovers cellular and environmental modifiers of genetic regulatory effects

finding: This SNP was associated with 3'UTR usage in the UBE2L3 gene; the C allele correlated with shortened 3'UTR mRNA, while the G allele was linked to lengthening of the 3'UTR. The SNP's association was particularly significant in tissues relevant to autoimmune diseases.
title: Genetic Basis of Alternative Polyadenylation is an Emerging Molecular Phenotype for Human Traits and Diseases

finding: Found in the MAPK1 locus, linked to reduced T cell proliferation, suggesting a regulatory influence on T cell activation.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The missense variant rs3915951 in CYP2D6 was identified in a single Papuan individual with a frequency of 12.5%. This unique allele suggests a specific archaic variant impact on modern drug metabolism.
title: Archaic introgression and variation in pharmacogenes and implications for local adaptation

finding: In the study, the interaction between the stress experienced by individuals and the rs4633 SNP genotype was examined. It was found that the T allele of rs4633, which is in complete linkage disequilibrium with the low activity A allele of rs4680, modified the effect of stress on the risk of developing chronic primary pain conditions (CPPCs). Specifically, individuals with two copies of the T allele in the high stress group exhibited trending increases in IL-6 and significant increases in IL-17A, suggesting these cytokines may serve as biomarkers for CPPCs.
title: A Novel Mouse Model of Chronic Primary Pain Conditions that Integrates Clinically Relevant Genetic and Environmental Factors

finding: Though the call rate for the Val158Met variant (rs4680) was only 70%, it was noted that the nearby SNP rs4633 was used as a proxy due to its perfect linkage (100% call rate) with rs4680. The findings indicated that the Met allele of rs4680, associated with lower enzymatic activity of catechol-O-methyltransferase (COMT), was linked to the stress response and subsequent risk of developing CPPCs, particularly through interactions with environmental stress factors.
title: A Novel Mouse Model of Chronic Primary Pain Conditions that Integrates Clinically Relevant Genetic and Environmental Factors

finding: The SNP rs133376 was mentioned in relation to its significant association with schizophrenia (SCZ) in genome-wide association studies (GWAS). The study highlighted the exploration of chromatin accessibility surrounding rs133376, demonstrating the relevance of its genomic context in understanding prospective molecular mechanisms underlying neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Transcriptome and chromatin accessibility landscapes across 25 distinct human brain regions expand the susceptibility gene set for neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The COMT Val158Met (rs4680) polymorphism was positively associated with local oscillation amplitudes and influenced long-range temporal correlations (LRTCs) of neuronal oscillations. This SNP was linked to higher COMT activity in homozygotes for Val158, resulting in lower levels of dopamine (DA) and norepinephrine (NE), contributing to inter-individual variability in neuronal oscillation dynamics.
title: Genetic polymorphisms in COMT and BDNF influence synchronization dynamics of human neuronal oscillations

finding: The lead SNP rs7284877 on chromosome 22q11.23 was associated with dilated cardiomyopathy, with the C-risk allele yielding an odds ratio of 1.33 [1.22 – 1.46] (p = 5.0 × 10<sup>−10</sup>). This SNP influenced the expression of the gene SMARCB1, which is implicated in cardiac function.
title: Genome wide association analysis in dilated cardiomyopathy reveals two new key players in systolic heart failure on chromosome 3p25.1 and 22q11.23

finding: Findings showed that the C-allele at rs2267447 was associated with reduced resting-state functional connectivity (rs-FC) between the right insula and left putamen in high pain sensitivity individuals.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: Participants carrying the A-allele of rs1081003 demonstrated lower rs-FC values between the right insula and left putamen, which aligned with findings of reduced connectivity in high pain sensitivity subjects.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: The RNA editing QTL rs202639 was associated with intron retention events that were linked to RNA editing in ZC3H7B, indicating the genetic effects on gene expression and splicing in the context of neurodegeneration.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The rs6971 polymorphism of the TSPO gene was genotyped in all participants, categorizing them as mixed-affinity binders (MABs) or high-affinity binders (HABs). The study indicated that TSPO availability was significantly influenced by this polymorphism, contributing to the variation in TSPO binding estimates observed in different individuals.
title: Effects of age, BMI and sex on the glial cell marker TSPO - a multicentre [11C]PBR28 HRRT PET study

finding: SNP rs5995992 was associated with MDD and mapped to a cCRE in microglia. It disrupted the binding site for the transcription factor FLI1, which is crucial for microglia development and homeostasis. This SNP showed Hi-C linkages with the ARL4C gene, which plays a role in lipid homeostasis within immune cells and is implicated in immune regulation.
title: Differential Chromatin Architecture and Risk Variants in Deep Layer Excitatory Neurons and Grey Matter Microglia Contribute to Major Depressive Disorder

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 GG variant was associated with increased susceptibility to metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD) and exhibited significantly higher steatosis, immune activation, and stellate cell activation in experiments using LAMPS compared to wild type CC. These findings were consistent with clinical correlations indicating the GG variant's role in disease progression and severity, including advanced fibrosis and inflammation.
title: Comparison of Wild-Type and High-risk PNPLA3 variants in a Human Biomimetic Liver Microphysiology System for Metabolic Dysfunction-associated Steatotic Liver Disease Precision Therapy

finding: Found to modulate TYMP gene expression with consequential effects on blood cell dependency.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Influenced transcript contributions in the TYMP gene, indicating a regulatory role.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The rs738409 polymorphism in the PNPLA3 gene was associated with liver damage and the development of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This finding provided insight into genetic predispositions to fatty liver disease, highlighting an important genetic risk factor in the context of liver health.
title: Modeling alcoholic liver disease in a human Liver-Chip

finding: The rs131804 SNP was also noted to be concordant with the ZFX binding motif and was included among the GTEx eQTLs associated with the heart, specifically implicating it in the regulation of genes involved in mitochondrial function and angiogenesis.
title: Statistical framework for calling allelic imbalance in high-throughput sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs5758550 was positively associated with the CYP2D6 *2 phenotype, resulting in implications for CYP2D6 genotyping panels and influencing metabolism of tamoxifen in breast cancer patients.
title: A unifying model to predict variable drug response for personalised medicine

finding: The SNP rs16947 was linked to the CYP2D6 *2 allele, affecting enzyme activity related to tamoxifen metabolism and further impacting drug response in breast cancer treatment.
title: A unifying model to predict variable drug response for personalised medicine

finding: The COMT Val108/158Met SNP (rs4680) was found to influence learning bias, with homozygotes for the Met allele exhibiting lower learning biases in motivated tasks. This highlights the impact of genetic variations associated with prefrontal dopaminergic function on individual differences in learning, particularly in tasks that involve action-valence interactions.
title: Motivational learning biases are differentially modulated by genetic determinants of striatal and prefrontal dopamine function

finding: The study demonstrated a 100% concordance between TaqMan and PharmacoScan genotyping for SNP rs5758550, which is associated with the CYP2D6 gene. This finding illustrates the reliability of these genotyping methods in identifying variants related to CYP2D6, thereby supporting effective pharmacogenomic applications.
title: Cross-validation of technologies for genotyping CYP2D6 and CYP2C19

finding: The finding associated with SNP rs6010240 was related to the regulation of MMP-9, a matrix metalloprotease involved in tumor pathogenesis and progression. In the context of leptin's role in promoting epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in breast cancer, the activation of MMP-9 through leptin, as demonstrated in MCF10A cells, suggested a significant relationship. This highlights the relevance of SNP rs6010240 in understanding the molecular mechanisms involved in tumor progression and invasion.
title: Leptin promotes expression of EMT-related transcription factors and invasion in a Src and FAK-dependent pathway in MCF10A mammary epithelial cells

finding: The SNP rs6010226 was associated with the expression of ELOVL2, a gene encoding an enzyme critical for the synthesis pathway of very long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids. The study found that higher expression of ELOVL2 correlated with worsened patient survival rates and was necessary for maintaining tumorigenic properties in vivo in glioblastoma cells, thereby indicating its significant role in the metabolism of cancer cells and their ability to thrive in a tumor microenvironment.
title: Capture at the single cell level of metabolic modules distinguishing aggressive and indolent glioblastoma cells

finding: The study reported a 100% concordance between TaqMan and PharmacoScan rs5758550 genotyping. This finding related to genotyping methodologies for the CYP2D6 gene and underscored the reliability of these platforms for identifying variants associated with drug metabolism.
title: Cross-validation of technologies for genotyping CYP2D6 and CYP2C19

finding: The SNP rs760294168, associated with the mtFAS gene MCAT, was found to be a pathogenic variant causing the amino acid substitution p.T271I. This finding directly connected the SNP to mitochondrial fatty acid synthesis impairment, emphasizing its significance in the context of related metabolic dysfunction.
title: Mitochondrial Phosphopantetheinylation is Required for Oxidative Function

finding: The rs738409 polymorphism in the PNPLA3 gene was associated with liver damage and the development of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This finding indicated that individuals carrying this polymorphism were at a higher risk for developing NAFLD, which is significant given the context of fatty liver disease's impact on public health and the associated complications.
title: Modeling alcoholic liver disease in a human Liver-Chip

finding: The rs4633 silent variant (C>T) was found to increase RNA abundance and potentially protein abundance in the context of low pain sensitivity due to relaxation of secondary structure near the translation initiation site.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The rs201641100 variant (C>T) resulted in increased RNA abundance as part of the analysis on codons that impacted RNA expression.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The rs8192488 variant (C>T) was reported to increase RNA abundance, aligning with findings on other variants that affected RNA levels.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The rs758271838 variant (C>T) was associated with increased ribosome load.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The rs149909767 variant (G>A) also increased ribosome load as deduced from ribosomal profiling.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The rs759340648 variant (G>A) was found to increase ribosome load.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The rs750684179 variant (T>C) was noted to decrease ribosome load.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The SNP rs1014971 was found to regulate APOBEC3B expression through an allele-specific effect on an enhancer located upstream of the APOBEC3 gene cluster. This regulation was linked to variations in the load of APOBEC-signature mutations across different tumors, impacting mutagenesis.
title: Isoform-specific characterization implicates alternative splicing in APOBEC3B as a mechanism restricting APOBEC-mediated mutagenesis

finding: The missense SNP rs139297 (Gly105Arg) was associated with the production of an A3H protein isoform that exhibited nuclear localization (A3H-I). This SNP was linked to the presence of APOBEC-signature mutations in breast and lung tumors lacking A3A and A3B, further implicating it in mutagenesis.
title: Isoform-specific characterization implicates alternative splicing in APOBEC3B as a mechanism restricting APOBEC-mediated mutagenesis

finding: SNP rs2331038 in the LRP5L gene was associated with serotonin levels in faeces, highlighting its role in the metabolomics of IBD.
title: The faecal metabolome and its determinants in inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The study identified the rs77563738 SNP associated with ADA2 deficiency (p.R169Q). This SNP was utilized in their SNV editing protocol aimed at correcting T cell mutations in patients, and they achieved up to 80% bi-allelic editing efficiency. The functional correction of the disease phenotype in patient T cells was demonstrated.
title: T cell correction pipeline for Inborn Errors of Immunity

finding: The SNP rs909685, located in the SYNGR1 gene, was shown to increase susceptibility to rheumatoid arthritis (RA) through a mechanism involving NK cell proportions. It was associated with higher expression levels of SYNGR1 and lower methylation levels of the associated CpG site cg19713460. The strong evidence for colocalization with the RA GWAS signal indicates its significant role in RA susceptibility.
title: Interaction molecular QTL mapping discovers cellular and environmental modifiers of genetic regulatory effects

finding: The rs397514502 variant corresponds to a rare amino acid substitution p.Q211E in the A4galt enzyme, which was found in only two families worldwide. This substitution was linked to an effect on the enzyme's acceptor specificity towards GalNAc-capped oligosaccharides, promoting the synthesis of NOR1 and NOR2 antigens, which are characterized by having a terminal Galα1→4GalNAc disaccharide structure. This finding shed light on how genetic variations in A4galt could influence glycan biosynthesis and potentially contribute to variations in susceptibility to Shiga toxin-associated diseases.
title: Delving into human α1,4-galactosyltransferase acceptor specificity: the role of enzyme dimerization

finding: The rs738409 variant, resulting in the I148M mutation in the PNPLA3 gene, was identified as the most prevalent genetic risk factor for developing metabolic-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD). This mutation functioned by sequestering the ABHD5 protein away from PNPLA2, which is crucial for TAG hydrolysis, promoting steatosis. Further findings indicated that the interaction between ABHD5 and PNPLA3 I148M was predominantly observed on lipid droplets (LDs), contrasting with the wild-type PNPLA3 interaction that primarily occurred on the endoplasmic reticulum. Ultimately, these interactions were critical for understanding the biochemical basis of the I148M variant's contribution to liver pathology.
title: Lipid Droplet Targeting of ABHD5 and PNPLA3 I148M is required to promote liver steatosis

finding: This SNP was associated with heart rate (P = 1.6 x 10^-9) and was found to loop to the promoter of GJA1, which encodes the gap junction protein connexin 43.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: Identified as a variant associated with SLE in Asian ancestries, rs2069235 showed much stronger enhancer activity for the 'A' risk allele versus the 'G' reference allele, with multiple transcription factors binding preferentially to the risk allele.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The SNP rs6519190, linked to creativity, was near the SYNGR1 gene, which had been associated with schizophrenia (SCZ), affirming the genetic relationships with psychiatric disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: The study indicated that the rs6971 genetic polymorphism impacted the binding of second-generation TSPO ligands, which are used to measure neuroinflammation. It was noted that PK11195, a first-generation ligand, was not affected by this polymorphism, suggesting its utility in assessing neuroinflammation in relation to neurodegenerative processes.
title: Correlation of Microglial Activation with White Matter Changes in Dementia with Lewy Bodies

finding: The rs28371706 variant in the CYP2D6 gene was found to have a frequency of 23.06% in African populations and was associated with decreased CYP2D6 enzymatic activity, which is relevant to drug metabolism in African Bantu populations.
title: The extent and impact of variation in ADME genes in sub-Saharan African populations

finding: This SNP was associated with CYP2D6 and exhibited less than 95% concordance, attributed to structural variants affecting dosage expectations.
title: Development and validation of a pharmacogenomics reporting workflow based on the Illumina Global Screening Array chip

finding: Associated with CYP2D6 and showed under 95% concordance, where reported dosages differed from expected due to structural variants.
title: Development and validation of a pharmacogenomics reporting workflow based on the Illumina Global Screening Array chip

finding: This SNP was linked to CYP2D6 and displayed a concordance rate under 95%, with discrepancies arising from structural variant dosages.
title: Development and validation of a pharmacogenomics reporting workflow based on the Illumina Global Screening Array chip

finding: This variant was identified at the GGT1 locus, significantly associated with liver enzyme gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT) in African ancestry individuals, suggesting its role in liver function.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: The SNP rs11090045 was identified as the most significant general-factor SNP in the study, with a p-value of 4.0 × 10<sup>−13</sup>. It was located in a gene-dense region on chromosome 22, overlapping multiple genes associated with risks related to brain development, synaptic function, and behaviors indicative of fear and anxiety. This position suggested it could act as a correlated proxy for multiple causal SNPs influencing the neuroticism general factor.
title: Genetic and neural bases of the neuroticism general factor

finding: The SNP rs6001946, located in the MKL1 gene, was found to be associated with schizophrenia in a Han Chinese population. This finding demonstrated a potential link between MKL1 and the pathophysiology of schizophrenia, highlighting the importance of MRTF-SRF signaling in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Cyclase-associated protein 1 (CAP1) represses MRTF-SRF-dependent gene expression in the mouse cerebral cortex

finding: The Valine allele of the COMT Val158Met polymorphism was significantly associated with greater susceptibility to framing effects among older adults. This finding indicated that higher frontal dopamine concentrations associated with the Met allele provided a protective effect against less consistent decision making. However, the association was not significant after controlling for demographic covariates.
title: COMT Val158Met polymorphism associated with greater susceptibility to framing effects in healthy older adults

finding: This intronic variant was identified in two Coriell samples showing the *17 allele, and it was classified as a novel subvariant, *17.003. It was noted for its rarity with an allele frequency of approximately 1%.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the pharmacogene CYP2D6 allows simultaneous haplotyping and detection of duplications

finding: The 5578C>G variant (rs143170489) was found in sample S013, which matched the *41 allele but contained non-catalogued variants. This sample was consequently assigned as a new subvariant, *41.004.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the pharmacogene CYP2D6 allows simultaneous haplotyping and detection of duplications

finding: This variant (5604C>T, rs557722765) was detected in sample S023 associated with the *4 allele, which was designated as a new subvariant, *4.026, owing to its rarity with an allele frequency of 0.001.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the pharmacogene CYP2D6 allows simultaneous haplotyping and detection of duplications

finding: The variant 3836G>A (rs1080992) was found in four samples and was the only variant present in each respective allele. It was designated as a new subvariant, *1.025, noted for its rarity with less than 1% allele frequency.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the pharmacogene CYP2D6 allows simultaneous haplotyping and detection of duplications

finding: Connected to variations in the expression of TYMP, showcasing its regulatory role.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs3747093 was found within a 7-mer motif predicted to influence the DNaseI footprint of the SCL/TAL transcription factor. Analysis revealed significant allelic skew in erythroid SCL/TAL ChIP-seq data, indicating its role in transcription factor binding dynamics.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The SNP rs855791 was identified as a missense variant in the TMPRSS6 gene, which encodes a protein critical for iron homeostasis. It was associated with iron status, hemoglobin levels, and erythrocyte volume.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The SNP rs5758389 was identified as a dominant factor driving the upregulation of ACO2 in Peruvian populations (PEL). ACO2 is significant for its role in the TCA cycle and was predicted to be downregulated in Europeans, indicating population-specific selection.
title: A gene-level test for directional selection on gene expression

finding: The I148M PNPLA3 variant (rs738409 C>G) inhibited triacylglycerol hydrolysis, leading to the accumulation of mutant PNPLA3 on lipid droplet surfaces. This accumulation contributed to the development of NAFLD. The presence of this variant, alongside rs641738 in MBOAT7 and rs58542926 in TM6SF2, was correlated with increased liver disease severity and higher risk of developing HCC in NAFLD patients.
title: TM6SF2/PNPLA3/MBOAT7 loss-of-function genetic variants impact on NAFLD development and progression both in patients and in in vitro models

finding: The SNP rs397514502 was identified as a point mutation leading to a p.Q211E substitution in the A4GALT gene. This variant was related to the enzyme's ability to synthesize glycosphingolipids, specifically facilitating the transfer of galactose to produce the rare NOR antigen, which is associated with the NOR phenotype in the human P1PK blood group system. This finding highlighted the importance of this SNP in influencing the enzymatic activity and the resulting blood group phenotype.
title: Missing the sweet spot: one of the two N-glycans on human Gb3/CD77 synthase is expendable

finding: The SNP rs5758550 was associated with enhancer haplotypes affecting the metabolic activity of the CYP2D6 enzyme. This finding was significant as it provided insights into personalized medicine approaches for drug metabolism based on genetic profiles.
title: Hubble2D6: A deep learning approach for predicting drug metabolic activity

finding: The SNP rs16947, corresponding to the CYP2D6 *2 allele, had implications for pharmacogenetics, particularly in the context of constructing CYP2D6 genotyping panels. This finding highlighted its relevance in predicting drug responses and optimizing treatment regimens.
title: Hubble2D6: A deep learning approach for predicting drug metabolic activity

finding: The SNP rs9306335 (T/C) was identified within an intergenic enhancer Alu element associated with four potential target genes: TAB1, MGAT3, MIEF1, and RPS19BP1. The study reported that with the T and C alleles at this SNP site, the target genes and the enhancer-associated RNA (eRNA) showed mismatch and perfect match in alignment, respectively. Furthermore, this SNP was annotated in the GWAS catalog as related to the glycosylation of immunoglobulin, which is pertinent to the immune function of the TAB1 gene and the glycosylation role of MGAT3, underscoring its significance in immunological processes.
title: Evidences for functional trans-acting eRNA-promoter R-loops at Alu sequences

finding: The variant rs713875 located near the LIF and HORMAD2 loci lowered expression of the enhancer ADDG22030591785.E specifically in CD-relevant CD8+ T cells, being validated by alternative allele methylation observed in whole blood.
title: Predicting cell-type-specific non-coding RNA transcription from genome sequence

finding: The SNP rs139296 acted as a cis-eQTL for the APOBEC3D gene, where subjects homozygous for the major alleles had lower transcript levels compared to heterozygotes or homozygotes for the minor allele (P < 0.01). This relationship indicated its role in modulating interindividual differences in risk of SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Lung expression of genes encoding SARS-CoV-2 cell entry molecules and antiviral restriction factors: interindividual differences are associated with age and germline variants

finding: The SNP rs9611092 was identified as a cis-eQTL for APOBEC3D, with similar findings to rs139296 in that major allele homozygotes exhibited lower expression levels. This contributed to understanding genetic susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: Lung expression of genes encoding SARS-CoV-2 cell entry molecules and antiviral restriction factors: interindividual differences are associated with age and germline variants

finding: The SNP rs139331 served as a significant cis-eQTL for APOBEC3D. Individuals with different genotypes at this locus displayed varying mRNA levels, indicating its importance in linking genetic factors to COVID-19 severity.
title: Lung expression of genes encoding SARS-CoV-2 cell entry molecules and antiviral restriction factors: interindividual differences are associated with age and germline variants

finding: The SNP rs8177832 was associated as a cis-eQTL for APOBEC3G, where homozygotes for the major allele showed higher expression levels compared to heterozygotes (P < 0.01). This SNP's significance underscored its potential impact on host responses to SARS-CoV-2.
title: Lung expression of genes encoding SARS-CoV-2 cell entry molecules and antiviral restriction factors: interindividual differences are associated with age and germline variants

finding: The SNP rs17537581 was identified as a cis-eQTL for the APOBEC3G gene, with results showing that individuals with homozygous major alleles had significantly higher expression levels. This finding had implications regarding individual susceptibility to viral infections including COVID-19.
title: Lung expression of genes encoding SARS-CoV-2 cell entry molecules and antiviral restriction factors: interindividual differences are associated with age and germline variants

finding: The SNP rs61362448 acted as a cis-eQTL for APOBEC3G, where homozygotes for the major alleles expressed significantly higher mRNA levels compared to those with minor alleles (P < 0.05). This contributed to understanding host genetic variability in response to viral infections.
title: Lung expression of genes encoding SARS-CoV-2 cell entry molecules and antiviral restriction factors: interindividual differences are associated with age and germline variants

finding: The SNP rs738469 was recognized as a cis-eQTL for APOBEC3G, linked to increased expression levels in homozygotes for the major allele, thus suggesting a role in genetic susceptibility and potential severity of COVID-19.
title: Lung expression of genes encoding SARS-CoV-2 cell entry molecules and antiviral restriction factors: interindividual differences are associated with age and germline variants

finding: Found associated in opposite directions with luminal A-like disease (OR 1.44, p=9.26×10^-14) and risk of TN disease (OR 0.61, p=2.55×10^-4), indicating subtype-specific effects.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs2269657 in the SREBF2 gene was reported to be associated with an increased risk of developing late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was noted that SREBF2 mRNA levels were significantly higher in the temporal cortex and cerebellum of AD patients. Furthermore, the expression of nuclear Srebp2 was negatively correlated with the presence of neurofibrillary tangles in the AD brain, indicating that SREBF2's role in cholesterol metabolism and its regulation of beta-amyloid production in neurons underscore its potential as a contributor to AD pathogenesis.
title: Regulation of astrocyte lipid metabolism and ApoE secretion by the microglial oxysterol, 25-hydroxycholesterol

finding: The rs738409 variant (I148M) in the PNPLA3 gene was identified as the greatest genetic risk factor for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD). This finding was significant as it indicated that the PNPLA3 I148M variant sequestered the co-activator ABHD5 away from the adipose triglyceride lipase (ATGL), leading to impaired TAG hydrolysis and subsequent steatosis. The I148M variant's association with ABHD5 was necessary for the promotion of liver steatosis, highlighting its role as a gain of function mutation.
title: Lipid droplet targeting of ABHD5 and PNPLA3 I148M is required to promote liver steatosis

finding: The study found a significant association between the Ala147Thr polymorphism in the TSPO gene (rs6971) and neuroinflammation levels in individuals with post-acute sequelae of COVID-19 (PASC). Individuals categorized as high- and mixed-affinity binders (Ala/Ala and Ala/Thr genotypes) exhibited increased neuroinflammation as measured by [11C]PBR28 PET neuroimaging when compared to normative healthy controls. The investigation highlighted the relevance of this SNP in understanding the neuroinflammatory processes contributing to persistent COVID-19 symptoms.
title: Neuroinflammation in post-acute sequelae of COVID-19 (PASC) as assessed by [11C]PBR28 PET correlates with vascular disease measures

finding: The promoter SNP rs4819554 in IL17RA was associated with early-onset coronary artery disease, reflecting the potential overlap between inflammatory responses and metabolic conditions like gestational diabetes.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs73885319 SNP, associated with the G1 variant (1024A→G) in the APOL1 gene, was found to have the highest de novo origination rate in Africans compared to Europeans. This mutation provided protection against African sleeping sickness caused by Trypanosoma brucei gambiense but was also linked to an increased risk of chronic kidney disease in homozygotes.
title: De novo rates of a Trypanosoma-resistant mutation in two human populations

finding: The rs60910145 SNP, part of the G1 variant in the APOL1 gene (1152T→G), was examined and associated with protection against Trypanosoma brucei gambiense, showing similar patterns of higher de novo origination rates in African populations relative to Europeans, along with the same increased risk of chronic kidney disease.
title: De novo rates of a Trypanosoma-resistant mutation in two human populations

finding: The rs71785313 SNP, associated with the G2 variant in the APOL1 gene, exhibited patterns of higher de novo origination frequency in Africans. This mutation, involving a 6 nucleotide in-frame deletion, provided protection against Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense and was noted for its relevance in discussions surrounding population-specific adaptive mutations and chronic kidney disease risk.
title: De novo rates of a Trypanosoma-resistant mutation in two human populations

finding: This SNP was found in the ASCC2 gene (22q12.2) and showed the strongest association to LDL and total cholesterol.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The COMT polymorphism (rs4680) was associated with differences in behavioral control, particularly in its influence on the modulation of model-based and model-free decision-making processes. Specifically, it was noted that individuals homozygous for the Val allele exhibited distinct behavioral control characteristics compared to those homozygous for the Met allele. This polymorphism provided insight into individual variations in goal-directed behavior.
title: A dopaminergic basis of behavioral control

finding: This SNP, located in an intron of TRIOBP on chromosome 22, was implicated in glaucoma by multiple GWAS. It showed the highest accessibility in retinal ganglion cells, potentially influencing TRIOBP expression in those cells, which are critical in glaucoma pathogenesis.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: It was predicted that rs713875, located near the LIF and HORMAD2 loci, lowered the expression of an enhancer in CD8+ T cells relevant to Crohn's disease. This finding aligned with its association with transcriptional activity in immunological contexts.
title: Predicting cell-type-specific non-coding RNA transcription from genome sequence

finding: SNP rs11705619 is linked to gene TXNRD2, which is relevant in the context of various genetic diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns
