finding: The research identified a 100% concordance between TaqMan and PharmacoScan genotyping using the SNP rs5758550. This SNP was associated with the CYP2D6 enzyme, indicating that variations in this SNP may influence drug metabolism and efficacy, which is critical for developing personalized medicine approaches.
title: Cross-validation of technologies for genotyping CYP2D6 and CYP2C19

finding: The SNP rs397514502 resulted in a point mutation c.631C>G, which caused a p.Q211E substitution in the human Gb3/CD77 synthase. This mutation significantly affected the enzymatic activity, as the mutein encoded by this variant could transfer galactose to a terminal GalNAc, producing the rare NOR antigen. The ability of the mutein to produce both Gb3 and the NOR antigen demonstrated rogue glycosyltransferase activity, revealing its role in the P1PK blood group system. Notably, this variant contributes to the phenotypic expression of the rare NOR phenotype when NOR antigens are present, linking the genetic variability in the A4GALT gene to distinct blood group characteristics.
title: Missing the sweet spot: one of the two N-glycans on human Gb3/CD77 synthase is expendable

finding: The rs397514502 SNP was associated with a point mutation c.631C>G that resulted in a p.Q211E substitution in the human Gb3/CD77 synthase enzyme. This mutation changed the enzyme's activity; the Q variant (from the high-frequency gene) catalyzed the production of globotriaosylceramide (Gb3) and the P1 antigen, while the E mutein not only produced these antigens but also added a galactose residue to a terminal GalNAc, resulting in the rare NOR antigen. This finding illustrated the significance of the SNP in the enzymatic function related to the human P1PK blood group system.
title: Missing the sweet spot: one of the two N-glycans on human Gb3/CD77 synthase curtails its activity

finding: The rs6151429 variant was associated with increased expression of the long isoform of the Arylsulfatase A (ARSA) gene, corroborating previous findings related to gene expression regulation through alternative polyadenylation.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs738409 in the PNPLA3 gene was shown to increase the risk of liver toxicity in multiple sclerosis patients treated with beta-interferon, indicating its relevance to treatment responses.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 GG variant was associated with increased steatosis, immune activation, stellate cell activation, and secretion of pro-fibrotic markers, indicating its role in the severity and progression of metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD). This variant demonstrated differential treatment response to resmetirom compared to wild type (CC), with greater efficacy observed in the CC LAMPS.
title: Comparison of Wild-Type and High-risk PNPLA3 variants in a Human Biomimetic Liver Microphysiology System for Metabolic Dysfunction-associated Steatotic Liver Disease Precision Therapy

finding: The rs17000526 variant, associated with APOBEC3B expression, showed a strong association with APOBEC signature mutations in bladder cancer, and a nominally significant association with APOBEC-related signatures in ER+ breast tumors.
title: Somatic mutational profiles and germline polygenic risk scores in human cancer

finding: The SNP rs117018441-T, located in an intron of CHADL, marked higher expression of CHADL compared to rs117018441-G in skeletal muscle and adipose tissue. This finding suggested that increased expression of CHADL might negatively regulate both bone and cartilage formation, making it a potential therapeutic target especially for knee osteoarthritis.
title: RNA sequencing reveals interacting key determinants of osteoarthritis acting in subchondral bone and articular cartilage

finding: The Met(-) variant of rs4680 from the COMT gene was identified as part of both the double and triple SNP combinations linked to an elevated risk for L-TRS. This SNP's role was correlated with variations in COMT activity, which is significant in dopaminergic pathways.
title: Genetic combination risk for schizophrenia

finding: The chromosomal position chr22:14573586:C:CCCGAGAG corresponds to SNP rs519400784, which was classified as Category 1d based on related regulatory signals in cattle, suggesting its involvement in important trait associations.
title: Annotation and assessment of functional variants in regulatory regions using epigenomic data in farm animals

finding: This SNP had been associated with NAFLD and was also included among significant signals for liver fat.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 variant was identified as a significant genetic predictor of NAFLD. A one-standard deviation increase in hepatic steatosis, driven by genetically instrumentation using rs738409, was associated with a 30% increased risk for type 2 diabetes (T2D) (OR=1.3, 95% CI: [1.2, 1.4], p=8.3e-14).
title: Mendelian Randomization Analysis Dissects the Relationship between NAFLD, T2D, and Obesity and Provides Implications to Precision Medicine

finding: This SNP in the PNPLA3 gene differed between Prakriti types and is associated with metabolic conditions including liver disease and alcohol-related cirrhosis.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The SNP rs11538371 was associated with the gene TIMP3 in astrocytes, which is an inhibitor of metalloproteinases. This connection was particularly relevant in the context of Parkinson's Disease (PD), linking TIMP3 to processes such as dopaminergic neuron degeneration and neuroinflammation associated with PD.
title: RNetDys: identification of disease-related impaired regulatory interactions due to SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2072814 was found linked to TIMP3 in astrocytes, indicating its involvement in the regulatory mechanisms related to Parkinson's Disease (PD) through the modulation of metalloproteinases, which are implicated in neuroinflammation and neuron degeneration.
title: RNetDys: identification of disease-related impaired regulatory interactions due to SNPs

finding: The SNP rs8137714 was associated with TIMP3 in astrocytes, suggesting its role in the impaired regulatory interactions relevant to Parkinson's Disease (PD), particularly in processes tied to astrocytic function and neuron protection.
title: RNetDys: identification of disease-related impaired regulatory interactions due to SNPs

finding: The SNP rs755622, which is located in the MIF promoter, was associated with an increased risk of incident coronary artery disease (CAD) specifically in individuals with TET2 clonal hematopoiesis (CH) among a cohort of approximately 341,000 individuals from the UK Biobank. The presence of the MIF risk allele (C allele) was linked to 42% of CAD events in TET2 CH individuals compared to 31% and 32% in DNMT3A CH and controls, respectively. This finding indicated that MIF signaling plays a pathogenic role in TET2 CH and suggested the potential for MIF inhibitors as therapeutic candidates.
title: Mutated cells mediate distinct inflammatory responses in clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The variant within the APOL1 gene (rs73885319) was linked with increased susceptibility to focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS), HIV-associated nephropathy (HIVAN), and end-stage kidney disease (ESKD). The frequency estimates in the African/African American genetic ancestry group revealed striking heterogeneity when analyzed through local ancestry versus aggregate estimates, underscoring the importance of considering ancestry-specific allele frequencies in genetic analysis.
title: Improved Allele Frequencies in gnomAD through Local Ancestry Inference

finding: The study indicated that individuals with the heterozygote genotype Val/Met (rs4680) exhibited significant amplitude enhancement in neural responses localized in the inferior frontal gyrus and the superior and middle temporal cortices in response to deviant auditory stimuli, compared to homozygote carriers of the Val/Val and Met/Met genotypes. This finding highlighted the role of the Val158Met SNP in influencing cognitive processes related to auditory predicting mechanisms.
title: Association between COMT gene Val158Met heterozygote polymorphism and enhanced brain predicting processes

finding: The RA rs71312076 demonstrated significant regulatory effects in gene expression independent of Neanderthal-derived alleles (NDAs). It was shown to have a regulatory influence even when tested in a non-introgressed European background, supporting its role in restoring lost regulatory functions in modern Europeans.
title: Neanderthal introgression reintroduced functional ancestral alleles lost in Eurasian populations

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 polymorphism was mentioned in the context of advanced liver fibrosis, suggesting its broader metabolic implications that could relate to complications in DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The variant rs7288455 was associated with increased expression of the gene CACNA1I across all cell populations when mutations of the reference A allele occurred, resulting in substitutions to C or G. This finding was significant particularly in the Sst Chodl subclass, where it accounted for one of the largest expression increases among all analyzed mutations. Contrarily, the reference A allele was predicted to decrease expression.
title: Predicting cell population-specific gene expression from genomic sequence

finding: The SNP rs397514502 was identified as a mutation leading to a p.Q211E substitution in the A4GALT enzyme. This substitution altered the enzyme's acceptor specificity towards GalNAc-capped oligosaccharides, which facilitated the synthesis of NOR1 and NOR2 antigens, terminally characterized by a Galα1→4GalNAc disaccharide. This finding highlighted the functional implications of the SNP in Shiga toxin-related glycosylation processes.
title: Delving into human α1,4-galactosyltransferase acceptor specificity: the role of enzyme dimerization

finding: The SNP rs5750477 demonstrated a genome-wide significant association with hearing difficulty in the UK Biobank (p = 1.3e-6). This SNP was located within an intron of the TRIOBP gene, marking it as a notable original finding linked to auditory function.
title: Biological insights from multi-omic analysis of 31 genomic risk loci for adult hearing difficulty

finding: The rs738409 SNP in PNPLA3, which causes an isoleucine to methionine substitution at codon position 148 (PNPLA3-I148M), was originally identified as a genetic variant associated with increased hepatic steatosis in populations. The research highlighted that the PNPLA3 148M variant was globally correlated with advanced non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and other liver diseases such as hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
title: Human hepatocyte PNPLA3 148M exacerbates rapid non-alcoholic steatohepatitis development in chimeric mice

finding: The rs734809 SNP was genotyped in hepatocytes that were transplanted into chimeric mice to study the effects of PNPLA3 variants on liver disease. It is intrinsically linked to the characterization of liver disease variants, specifically regarding the PNPLA3-I148M variant.
title: Human hepatocyte PNPLA3 148M exacerbates rapid non-alcoholic steatohepatitis development in chimeric mice

finding: The SNP rs2267131 was enriched in the enhancer 22.1008E at the XBP1 locus in acinar cells. This enhancer was found to have the highest EPIC effect size (0.43) in acinar cells, indicating a strong regulatory effect on XBP1 transcription.
title: Predictive Prioritization of Enhancers Associated with Pancreas Disease Risk

finding: The SNP rs5752810 was associated with enhancer 22.1015E at the XBP1 locus in acinar cells. While this enhancer had a lower EPIC effect size (0.05) compared to 22.1008E, it still demonstrated relevance in regulating XBP1 transcription in acinar cells.
title: Predictive Prioritization of Enhancers Associated with Pancreas Disease Risk

finding: Similar to rs5752810, the SNP rs5752811 was also found to be enriched in enhancer 22.1015E at the XBP1 locus in acinar cells and contributed to regulating XBP1 transcription, aligning with the findings of acinar cell enhancer interactions.
title: Predictive Prioritization of Enhancers Associated with Pancreas Disease Risk

finding: The rs73885319 variant was identified as a G1 risk variant in the APOL1 gene, which was introduced into the 1016SevA iPSC line. This variant was confirmed to be knocked in at its native genomic locus through the CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing approach. Functional studies using genome-edited kidney organoids revealed that the presence of this variant was associated with cell-specific changes in gene expression when subjected to interferon gamma treatment.
title: Profiling APOL1 Nephropathy Risk Variants in Genome-Edited Kidney Organoids with Single-Cell Transcriptomics

finding: The rs60910145 variant was also identified as a G1 risk variant in the APOL1 gene, similarly introduced into the 1016SevA iPSC line via CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing. This variant was successfully knocked in at its native genomic locus, and like rs73885319, its presence was linked to changes in the gene expression profile of kidney organoids during interferon gamma exposure.
title: Profiling APOL1 Nephropathy Risk Variants in Genome-Edited Kidney Organoids with Single-Cell Transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs746803316 was identified as one of the four allele-defining variants that had not been previously catalogued as CYP2D6 core variants in the PharmVar database. It was observed in the context of novel alleles related to pharmacogenomics and drug metabolism.
title: The variation landscape of CYP2D6 in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The SNP rs3915951 was reported as an allele-defining variant, which had not been included in the PharmVar database until this study. Its identification contributed to the understanding of CYP2D6 genetic variability affecting drug metabolism.
title: The variation landscape of CYP2D6 in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The SNP rs1135830 was recognized as one of the novel core variants linked to the CYP2D6 gene. It had not been previously documented in the PharmVar database, thus highlighting a new contributor to the understanding of allelic variants affecting pharmacogenomic outcomes.
title: The variation landscape of CYP2D6 in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The SNP rs759234339 was among those not previously characterized as CYP2D6 core variants in the PharmVar database. Its discovery enriched the data surrounding CYP2D6 alleles and their implications in personalized medicine.
title: The variation landscape of CYP2D6 in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The rs6971 polymorphism was associated with differential binding affinities of TSPO ligands, identified as low-affinity binding (LAB), medium-affinity binding (MAB), and high-affinity binding (HAB) states. This polymorphism impacted the involvement of TSPO in the tumor microenvironment (TME) of glioblastoma, where tumor cells demonstrated enhanced TSPO radiotracer uptake compared to tumor-associated microglia/macrophages (TAMs). The study highlighted that cellular tracer uptake measures informed the precise recruitment of TSPO-targeting agents in glioblastoma, aiding in the development of TAM-specific radioligands.
title: Deciphering sources of PET signals in the tumor microenvironment of glioblastoma at cellular resolution

finding: The rs10314 variant in the claudin-5 gene was associated with a diagnosis of schizophrenia (SZ) specifically in a large cohort of female patients with 22q11.2 deletion syndrome (22qDS). This association was highlighted in recent work by the authors' lab, demonstrating the significance of this SNP in the context of the neuropsychiatric disorder linked to the genetic risk factor.
title: Disruption of the Blood-Brain Barrier in 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs138349 was identified as the lead candidate causal variant in the chr22:41049522-41449522 locus associated with cholesterol and LDL levels, colocalizing with a fetal-adult eQTL module. The association was characterized by an effect size for ADSL expression in iPSC-PPC of 0.78 and suggested that altered expression of ADSL and ST13 might influence cholesterol and LDL levels.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The silent variant rs4633, located in the wobble position of H62, was found to increase protein abundance in HEK293 cells, as it relaxes secondary structure near the translation initiation site. This suggested that its effect on RNA abundance might facilitate translation initiation.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The variant rs201641100 (P143P, C>T) was identified as increasing RNA abundance, suggesting it has a relevant influence on gene expression.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The variant rs8192488 (A146A, C>T) was discovered to also increase RNA abundance, indicating its role in potentially influencing COMT gene expression.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The variant rs758271838 (L60L, C>T) was noted for increasing ribosome load, thus having an impact on the translation process.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The SNP rs149909767 (G70R, G>A) was identified as a variant that increases ribosome load, relating to enhanced translational efficiency.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The variant rs759340648 (D144N, G>A) was also reported to increase ribosome load, contributing to changes in translation dynamics.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The variant rs750684179 (G52G, T>C) was identified as decreasing ribosome load, potentially impacting gene expression negatively.
title: Integrated multiplexed assays of variant effect reveal cis-regulatory determinants of catechol-O-methyltransferase gene expression

finding: The SNP rs77601382 was associated with nonverbal reasoning performance in a large cohort study involving 3,319 individuals aged 8-21 years. This association reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 4.6×10⁻⁸, indicating its importance in understanding cognitive abilities linked to this gene.
title: Multi-scale systems genomics analysis predicts pathways, cell types and drug targets involved in normative human cognition variation

finding: Similar to rs77601382, rs5765534 emerged as a significant SNP related to nonverbal reasoning, also achieving genome-wide significance (p=4.6×10⁻⁸). This linkage suggested a connection between the genetic variation in the FBLN1 gene and the cognitive ability to perform nonverbal reasoning tasks.
title: Multi-scale systems genomics analysis predicts pathways, cell types and drug targets involved in normative human cognition variation

finding: The SNP rs74825248 was another significant finding related to nonverbal reasoning performance, located within the region of the FBLN1 gene, and achieved genome-wide significance (p=4.64e-8). This finding reinforced the association between FBLN1 and cognitive function.
title: Multi-scale systems genomics analysis predicts pathways, cell types and drug targets involved in normative human cognition variation

finding: The COMT rs4680 G/G genotype showed a significant increase in C-peptide concentrations after aripiprazole administration compared to A carriers, supporting its role in glucose metabolism and metabolic changes induced by these antipsychotics.
title: Metabolic effects of aripiprazole and olanzapine multiple-dose treatment in healthy volunteers. Association with pharmacogenetics

finding: Similar to rs4680, the COMT rs13306278 T carriers exhibited significantly higher C-peptide concentrations post-aripiprazole treatment than A carriers, suggesting a genetic predisposition impacting glucose regulation.
title: Metabolic effects of aripiprazole and olanzapine multiple-dose treatment in healthy volunteers. Association with pharmacogenetics

finding: The SNP rs738409, which corresponds to the PNPLA3-I148M mutation, was recognized as the most significant genetic determinant of fatty liver disease globally. It was found to impair the secretion of Apolipoprotein B (ApoB) from hepatocytes, hindering VLDL secretion. This defect was not attributed to a generalized secretory defect, nor equated to a loss of function of PNPLA3. Furthermore, the defect was conserved in mice expressing the human I148M variant. Also, the finding indicated that I148M cells showed an enrichment in polyunsaturated fatty acid (PUFA)-containing triglycerides, affecting membrane dynamics and VLDL biogenesis, thereby amplifying fatty liver risk by obstructing CGI-58-dependent pathways for liver triglyceride clearance.
title: PNPLA3-I148M is a Neomorph that Interferes with Two Primary Hepatic Triglyceride Clearance Pathways

finding: Located within the LOC102723769-OR11H1-POTEH locus, the SNP rs4911713 was linked to the salivary microbial species F0422 uSGB 392 belonging to family Veillonellaceae, showing a significant association with p = 2.11 × 10^-12.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The SNP rs5758837, located in the promoter region of the CYB5R3 gene, was associated with phenotypes related to diabetes, as indicated by the PheWAS analysis. This association suggested that variations at this locus could influence susceptibility to diabetes through regulation of genes linked to β-cell function and mitochondrial health.
title: Cyb5r3 links FoxO1-dependent mitochondrial dysfunction with β-cell failure

finding: The SNP rs4911713, located near OR11H1, was associated with the oral taxa F0422 uSGB 392. This relationship was significant in both discovery and replication cohorts, highlighting the potential influence of genetic factors on this specific oral microbial presence.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The SNP rs6010376 was associated with the transcriptional activity of STAT3 in glioblastoma, as indicated by significant findings connecting it to the expression regulation of RIT1, an oncogene identified in the study as a potential biomarker and therapeutic target.
title: RIT1: A Novel Biomarker in Glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs397514502 represented a rare enzyme variant (p.Q211E) of human A4galt, identified in only two families worldwide. This substitution affected enzyme acceptor specificity towards GalNAc-capped oligosaccharides, enabling the synthesis of NOR1 and NOR2 antigens, which were terminally characterized by a Galα1→4GalNAc disaccharide.
title: Delving into human α1,4-galactosyltransferase acceptor specificity: the role of enzyme dimerization

finding: The SNP rs137969 was reported as another MS-specific deepSNP, functioning in conjunction with other SNPs in influencing chromatin features related to MS etiology.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The rs738409 C>G SNP in PNPLA3, resulting in the I148M variant, was identified as a significant factor in the progression of Metabolic Dysfunction-Associated Steatotic Liver Disease (MASLD). Carriers of the GG genotype exhibited severely impaired mitochondrial function, with diminished oxidative phosphorylation (OXPHOS) capacity and increased reactive oxygen species (ROS) production, which was directly associated with the severity of MASLD.
title: Serum mitochondrial bioenergetics as fingerprint of the hepatic one: how to monitor genetic MASLD

finding: The rs738409 SNP, specifically the PNPLA3 I148M variant, was found to significantly affect hepatic Very Low-Density Lipoprotein (VLDL) secretion in humans. This genetic variant was linked to disrupted lipid metabolism which plays a vital role in the maternal supply of essential fatty acids (EFAs) during pregnancy. Because the study emphasized how maternal adaptations were crucial for the transfer of lipids to the fetus, this SNP's impact on lipid metabolism became relevant to understanding maternal-fetal health outcomes associated with EFAs.
title: A co-ordinated transcriptional programme in the maternal liver supplies LC-PUFAs to the conceptus using phospholipids

finding: The SNP rs136046 was found to be associated with monocyte counts, suggesting a significant role of ACKR2 in modulating these cells.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: The SNP rs755622 was associated with an elevated risk of incident coronary artery disease (CAD) in individuals with TET2 clonal hematopoiesis (CH) among a cohort of approximately 341,000 individuals in the UK Biobank. Specifically, individuals harboring the risk allele (C) had a higher incidence of CAD, highlighting MIF as a significant mediator in the pathology associated with TET2 CH. The analysis adjusted for key covariates such as age, sex, hypertension, diabetes, and smoking history.
title: Mutated cells mediate distinct inflammatory responses in clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The finding demonstrated that the COMT Val158Met (rs4680) polymorphism was associated with modulation of neuronal dynamics, particularly influencing local oscillation amplitudes and their long-range temporal correlations (LRTCs). This SNP also affected cognitive functions dependent on the prefrontal cortex, with Val homozygotes showing different COMT activity and resultant brain DA levels compared to Met homozygotes.
title: Genetic polymorphisms in COMT and BDNF influence synchronization dynamics of human neuronal oscillations

finding: The SNP rs738409 was found to be significantly associated with liver fat, with an impressive p-value of 4.6×10−166. This SNP was linked to multiple genes including PNPLA3, SAMM50, and PARVB, which have been previously associated with MAFLD, highlighting its relevance in genetic predisposition to liver fat accumulation.
title: The role of liver fat in cardiometabolic diseases is highlighted by genome-wide association study of MRI-derived measures of body composition

finding: The study identified a significant association between the PNPLA3 rs738409 variant (I148M) and an increased susceptibility to mitochondrial injury in hepatocyte-like cells (HLCs) derived from human induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs). This finding was especially evident when comparing the major homozygous for the variant (PNPLA3-WT or I148I) and the minor homozygous for the variant (PNPLA3-I148M) lines. The PNPLA3-I148M line displayed a heightened response to injuries induced by adipokines like resistin and myokines such as myostatin, which contributes to the understanding of genetic predispositions in metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD). The discovery highlighted genomic modifiers' role in the context of MASLD and informed potential interventions.
title: Dissecting compounded hepatocyte injury in a model of MASLD progression from human induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: The SNP rs35742686 (2549delA) was found to predict higher levels of CYP2D6 enzymatic activity, which correlated positively with increased cortical activity in occipito-parietal areas during spatial attentional tasks.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The SNP rs1065852 (100C>T) was associated with greater cortical activity during attention tasks, suggesting its role in enhancing enzymatic activity of CYP2D6 and influencing cognitive processes.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The SNP rs3892097 (1846G>A) showed a positive correlation with cortical activity related to attentional processes, confirming its significance in modulating CYP2D6 function.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The SNP rs5030655 (1707delT) was positively correlated with altered cortical responses, specifically indicating its role in the differential cognitive efficiency observed between rapid and poor metabolizers.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The SNP rs28371725 (2988G>A) was linked to increased cortical modulation in attention tasks, affirming its influence on CYP2D6-mediated drug metabolism and cognitive processes.
title: Effects of genetic variability of CYP2D6 on neural substrates of sustained attention during on-task activity

finding: The TP rs11479 variant was reported to result in a lower treatment response, emphasizing its role in 5-FU metabolism.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: This intergenic variant was associated with prostate and lung cancers, influencing PACSIN2 expression.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: rs9612520 showed a strong iPSC-CVPC-specific eQTL signal for DDTL, indicating that its effect was significant only in iPSC-derived samples.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The finding revealed that rs138349 (chr22:41249522:A>G) served as the lead candidate causal variant in the cholesterol and LDL GWAS locus, linking it to the expression of ADSL during pancreas development.
title: Disease-associated regulatory variation often displays plasticity or temporal-specificity in fetal pancreas

finding: The rs738409 SNP was identified as a missense lead variant in the PNPLA3 gene, which is a well-established locus for non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This variant demonstrated a significant colocalization with a GWAS signal for type 2 diabetes. Furthermore, it was associated with a trans-protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL) affecting the ADP Ribosylation Factor Interacting Protein 2 (ARFIP2), which was shown to be strongly downregulated in type 2 diabetes patients from the AGES cohort. The findings suggest that the missense variant in PNPLA3 may influence the circulating levels of ARFIP2, possibly linking it to type 2 diabetes risk.
title: A genome-wide association study of serum proteins reveals shared loci with common diseases

finding: Another candidate near HORMAD2, showing potential functional implications in T1D through Treg interaction.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: The SNP rs16947 (2851C>T) was part of the haplotype CYP2D6*13 and CYP2D6*2, with the former being a variant and the latter being reference. The ratio for this SNP was 2.04 indicating variant presence in two haplotypes on one chromosome, while the reference was present on the other.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: For SNP rs1135840 (4181G>C), the analysis showed that the haplotypes CYP2D6*13, CYP2D6*4, CYP2D6*36, and CYP2D6*10 were all variant. The ratios were calculated as 1.65 for CYP2D6*13, 16.56 for CYP2D6*4, and 15.95 for CYP2D6*36, all consistent with the known variants.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The SNP rs3892097 was uniquely associated with the CYP2D6*4 haplotype, which showed a ratio of infinity, aligning perfectly with prior consensus genotyping outcomes.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The SNP rs1065852 showed a calculated ratio of 1.22 compared to an expected ratio of 2, indicating that not all alleles in the sample matched the expected variants. This SNP was variant in CYP2D6*36 and CYP2D6*10 haplotypes.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 GG variant was associated with increased MASLD progression, demonstrating heightened steatosis, immune activation, stellate cell activation, and secretion of pro-fibrotic markers compared to the wild type CC variant. This finding highlighted the PNPLA3 gene's crucial role in lipid metabolism and its impact on liver disease outcomes.
title: Comparison of Wild-Type and High-risk PNPLA3 variants in a Human Biomimetic Liver Microphysiology System for Metabolic Dysfunction-associated Steatotic Liver Disease Precision Therapy

finding: The SNP rs397514502 represented a mutation (p.Q211E, c.631C>G) in the A4GALT gene, resulting in the rare enzyme variant A4Gmut. This variant enabled the transfer of galactose to GalNAc-terminating glycosphingolipids, facilitating the synthesis of NOR, NOR1, and NOR2 glycosphingolipids. These findings were crucial as they provided insights into the enzyme's role in forming glycosphingolipid structures relevant to the P1PK histo-blood group system, thereby impacting Stx binding and susceptibility.
title: B4GALT5-deficient CHO-Lec2 cells expressing human α1,4-galactosyltransferase: a glycoengineered cell model for studying Shiga toxin receptors

finding: The RA rs71312076 demonstrated significant regulatory effects in a massively parallel reporter assay, providing evidence for its independent regulatory activity on gene expression in European populations, regardless of the presence of any Neanderthal-derived alleles.
title: Neanderthal introgression reintroduced functional alleles lost in the human out of Africa bottleneck

finding: The SNP rs5764238 was reported to have a significant allelic effect on SPI1 binding, as indicated by a binding quantitative trait locus (bQTL) study. The study used machine learning models trained on SPI1 ChIP-seq and ATAC-seq profiles, revealing that the alternate (G) allele enhances SPI1 binding and chromatin accessibility. The findings included that the G allele created a strong SPI1 binding motif, which was corroborated by nucleotide-resolution DeepLIFT importance scores, affirming the motif as the primary driver of enhanced signal.
title: The dynseq genome browser track enables visualization of context-specific, dynamic DNA sequence features at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The study indicated that the human hepatocytes used in their experiments were heterozygous for the PNPLA3 NASH-risk variant at rs738409 (C/G). This specific genotype at rs738409 is known to exacerbate the progression of nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) in human liver models, and the success of the GalNAc-siTAZ therapy in mice reconstituted with these heterozygous hepatocytes suggested a positive therapeutic outcome, supporting the notion that targeting TAZ could be beneficial in treating NASH, particularly in individuals with this genetic risk variant.
title: Hepatocyte-Targeted siTAZ Therapy Lowers Liver Fibrosis in NASH Diet-Fed Chimeric Mice with Hepatocyte-Humanized Livers

finding: The SNP rs11538371 was associated with the gene TIMP3 in astrocytes, indicating a potential role in Parkinson's Disease (PD). TIMP3 serves as an inhibitor of metalloproteinases, which are implicated in key PD processes such as dopaminergic neuron degeneration, neuroinflammation, and proteolysis of alpha-synuclein.
title: RNetDys: identification of disease-related impaired regulatory interactions due to SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2072814 was linked to TIMP3 specifically in astrocytes, further supporting its involvement in Parkinson's Disease (PD). Similar to rs11538371, it highlights the role of TIMP3 in various PD-related mechanisms.
title: RNetDys: identification of disease-related impaired regulatory interactions due to SNPs

finding: The SNP rs8137714 was found to associate with TIMP3 in astrocytes, demonstrating its connection to Parkinson's Disease (PD). This linkage emphasizes the importance of TIMP3 in the disease process.
title: RNetDys: identification of disease-related impaired regulatory interactions due to SNPs

finding: The missense variant rs36062310 (Val504Met) within the KLHDC7B gene demonstrated a strong association with self-reported hearing loss in the UK Biobank GWAS, showing a p-value of 1.90E-22. Additionally, a meta-analysis identified the same variant with a p-value of 4.24E-26 linked to hearing loss in adults. This variant has also been associated with increased risk of hearing loss due to heterozygous predicted loss-of-function variants in KLHDC7B, yielding an odds ratio of 2.145, reinforcing the gene's status as a candidate for age-related hearing loss (ARHL). This was the first documented association of KLHDC7B with auditory function in humans.
title: KLHDC7B, a novel gene associated with age-related hearing loss in humans, is required for the maintenance of hearing in mice

finding: The variant rs6519353 was associated with a large effect on EGR1 binding by altering 7 overlapping binding sites, highlighting its role in gene regulation.
title: Overlapping binding sites underlie TF genomic occupancy

finding: This SNP was identified as the index SNP for Haplogroup A and demonstrated a high linkage (r²=0.93) with this haplogroup in the global population. Its association with haplogroup frequency was monitored across various historical time windows.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: This SNP served as the index SNP for Haplogroup B, showing perfect linkage (r²=1) to this haplogroup in the global population. Changes in its associated haplogroup frequency were analyzed over time.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: This SNP was designated as the index SNP for Haplogroup C with a perfect linkage (r²=1) in populations such as CEU and JPT, allowing for observation of frequency stability over time.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: This SNP, linked to Haplogroup B, was significantly associated with asthma exacerbations in children (p=5.0E-6; OR=1.52) in admixed populations and Europeans (p=7.52E-3), highlighting its role in immune response.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: Serving as the index SNP for sub-Haplogroup B2, this SNP demonstrated a significant association with asthma exacerbations (p=3.0E-6, OR=2.13), thereby contributing to the understanding of Haplogroup B's impact on health.
title: Distinct haplogroups with star-like diversification in the APOBEC3 regulatory region indicate ancient viral pandemics before and during the Out-of-Africa migration of modern humans

finding: The non-synonymous single nucleotide variant rs16947 was found to be strongly associated with an increased abundance of CYP2D6 exon 3 skipping junctions. This association indicated that the risk allele may lead to an in-frame deletion, shortening the protein by 51 amino acids and reducing enzyme activity involved in drug metabolism.
title: Variations and expression features of CYP2D6 contribute to schizophrenia risk

finding: SNP rs133377 was associated with the abundance of junctions Exon_34 and Exon_24 in the CYP2D6 gene, indicating its involvement in splicing processes. It was also located within active transcription start sites, highlighting its potential regulatory role in gene expression and being in high linkage disequilibrium with rs16947.
title: Variations and expression features of CYP2D6 contribute to schizophrenia risk

finding: The rs13054904 SNP is intronic in the RSPH14 gene and, although its specific functionality related to nephrolithiasis was unclear, it is associated with the broader genetic landscape of CaSR signaling.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs147122512 was noted as an intronic variant of SGSM3, which is up-regulated in myocardial infarction mice hearts. This suggests a potential linkage between this SNP, cholesterol levels, and cardiovascular health.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The SNP rs73885319 in the APOL gene was indicated as likely evolving due to local adaptations and was also in the top 5% of the MU distribution.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The genetic variation in the ADORA2A gene, specifically the rs5751876 polymorphism, was associated with individual differences in oscillatory alpha power. In a study with healthy volunteers, homozygous C-allele carriers demonstrated higher alpha power compared to both heterozygous and homozygous T-allele carriers (p = 0.014). Additionally, this genetic variation influenced A1 adenosine receptor binding potential across various brain regions, particularly significant in the occipital regions after correction for multiple testing (p = 0.006). Furthermore, a correlation between oscillatory alpha power and A1 receptor availability was specifically noted among female participants.
title: A genetic variation in the adenosine A2A receptor gene contributes to variability in oscillatory alpha power in wake and sleep EEG and A1 adenosine receptor availability in the human brain

finding: This SNP impacted ARVCF gene expression and was shown to be significant in the functionally relevant context of CAD-related gene regulation via CRISPR assays.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The rs738409 GG genotype was identified as a risk factor for the development of cirrhosis-related complications specifically in the NAFLD patient group. The study found a significant increase in the odds ratio for complications in these patients when comparing the GG genotype to the CC genotype. This association highlighted the rs738409 polymorphism's clinical significance in evaluating risk factors for fibrosis progression due to hepatic steatosis.
title: The impact of PNPLA3 and TM6SF2 in cirrhosis related complications

finding: The Val158Met polymorphism (rs4680) in the COMT gene was found to correlate with temporal impulsivity. Specifically, Val homozygous individuals exhibited higher preference for immediate rewards, which was associated with increased delay discounting. This finding suggested a connection between lower prefrontal dopamine levels, due to the less functional COMT enzyme in Val homozygotes, and increased temporal impulsivity, although it was noted that this relationship also depended on age and gender.
title: DRD2/ANKK1 Taq1A but not COMT single nucleotide polymorphisms contribute to the link between temporal impulsivity and obesity in men

finding: The SNP rs755622 in the MIF promoter was found to be associated with increased leukocyte infiltration in glioblastoma (GBM), indicating a significant role in shaping the tumor immune microenvironment. Specifically, it was correlated with enhanced expression of lactotransferrin (LTF), which is proposed as a biomarker for immune infiltration within tumors.
title: The MIF SNP rs755622 is a germline determinant of tumor immune activation in Glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs6006399, located in the HORMAD2 gene at 22q12.1, was significantly associated with forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) with a p-value of 1.9×10^-18. This SNP was highlighted as part of the genetic basis related to lung function impairment.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The analysis of SNP rs131811 involved its introduction into the 293T human cell line using CRISPR gene editing. After the editing process and subsequent amplification via PCR, sequencing data was generated and analyzed using the EdiTyper tool. Out of a total of 70,649 reads aligned, 69,625 were deemed well-aligned and available for further analysis. This successful detection and alignment of reads confirmed the introduction of rs131811, thereby demonstrating the utility of EdiTyper for analyzing genomic edits in cell populations.
title: EdiTyper: a high-throughput tool for analysis of targeted sequencing data from genome editing experiments

finding: This variant in CHEK2 was associated with increased MPN risk and led to a missense mutation, indicating its potential functions tied to hematopoietic function.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The variant rs136403 was implicated in the relationship between pack-years of smoking and waist circumference (WC) as well as waist circumferences indicating its influence on abdominal adiposity.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs738409 found in PNPLA3 showed a significant association with the correlation of triglycerides and BMI, as well as the variance of triglycerides. This SNP was also confirmed to be significantly linked with BMI through cross-referencing with PheWAS results.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: This SNP was found to significantly change the use of the affected splice site, with individuals homozygous for the stronger allele exhibiting higher transcription of the associated gene.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: This SNP caused a measurable increase in the use of cryptic splice sites, with significant fold changes detected experimentally.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: This SNP resulted in an increase in the use of a cryptic splice site, demonstrating a notable effect on the splicing process.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: The SNP exhibited a direct correlation with decreased natural splice site strength and lower overall expression levels.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: This SNP was associated with changes in splice isoform levels and increased cryptic site use.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: This SNP was correlated with reduced amplification of mRNA and lower expression levels compared with wild type.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: The variant rs3892097, part of the CYP2D6 *4 haplotype, was observed as heterozygous in the Denisovan individual. This SNP was shown to confer an intermediate metabolizer status in living humans, impacting drug metabolism.
title: Pharmacogenetic variation in Neanderthals and Denisovans and implications for human health and response to medications

finding: Similar to rs3892097, the SNP rs1065852 was also found in the CYP2D6 *4 haplotype identified in the Denisovan individual, contributing to an intermediate metabolizer phenotype. This indicated a shared pharmacogenetic influence on drug metabolism.
title: Pharmacogenetic variation in Neanderthals and Denisovans and implications for human health and response to medications

finding: The SNP rs3915951 was identified as an exonic missense variant in CYP2D6, found heterozygous in a Papuan individual. This variant was likely to alter enzyme function, reflecting evolutionary adaptations and effects on drug metabolism.
title: Pharmacogenetic variation in Neanderthals and Denisovans and implications for human health and response to medications

finding: The SNP rs16947, which corresponds to 2851C>T, was demonstrated to have a ratio of 2.04 for the CYP2D6 haplotype with the genotype CYP2D6(*13+*2)/(*1). This indicated that the CYP2D6*13 and CYP2D6*2 haplotypes were variant at this position, while the haplotype with CYP2D6*1 was reference.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: For SNP rs1135840, which corresponds to 4181G>C, the calculated mean ratio was 1.72 (95% CI [1.62, 1.81]) for samples with the expected ratio of 2. This was consistent with variant alleles found in the CYP2D6 haplotypes CYP2D6*13, CYP2D6*2, CYP2D6*36, and CYP2D6*10.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The SNP rs3892097, which defines the CYP2D6*4 variant, exhibited a ratio of infinity, confirming the prior consensus genotype. This high ratio indicated that both CYP2D6*4 genes present in the sample had the variant alleles.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The SNP rs1065852 had a calculated ratio of 1.22 for the CYP2D6 genotype (*36+*10)/(*35). The expected ratio for this SNP was 2, reflecting the presence of variant alleles in both CYP2D6*10 and CYP2D6*36 haplotypes, while CYP2D6*35 does not have the variant allele.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The SNP rs6006399, associated with the gene HORMAD2 at locus 22q12.1, showed a significant association with forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1), with a p-value of 1.9×10^-18. This finding contributed to understanding genetic influences on lung function.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs713782 was implicated as a candidate causal variant for coronary heart disease (CHD), explaining over 76% of the posterior probability of colocalization with five related traits. Through HyPrColoc, it was revealed that this risk variant shared genetic associations with multiple conventional CHD risk factors.
title: A fast and efficient colocalization algorithm for identifying shared genetic risk factors across multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs134873 revealed significant allelic differences in K562 and SH-SY5Y cells, and it was confirmed as an eQTL in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, indicating its relevance in gene expression linked to psychiatric conditions.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: The SNP rs35898507 was identified within the A3F upstream ORF (uORF) region, demonstrating a minor allele frequency (MAF) greater than 0.01. This variant induced an amino acid change from glycine (G) to valine (V) in the uORF, with G being the ancestral allele present in more than 96% of the human population. The analysis suggested that while this SNP was common, it did not lead to any dramatic effects on the crucial uORF functional elements.
title: A conserved uORF regulates APOBEC3G translation and is targeted by HIV-1 Vif protein to repress the antiviral factor

finding: The SNP rs738409 was associated with liver damage and the development of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). In the context of fatty liver disease (FLD) progression, this finding highlighted the role of PNPLA3 polymorphism in increasing susceptibility to liver injury, particularly relevant for understanding the mechanisms behind both alcohol-induced liver disease (ALD) and nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
title: Modeling alcoholic liver disease in a human Liver-Chip

finding: This frameshift variant in <italic>CHEK2</italic> was among the coding changes linked to increased breast cancer risk.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The missense variant in <italic>CHEK2</italic> was also found to be a recognized coding change associated with breast cancer.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: This SNP in the APOL3 gene displayed robust signals of positive selection and was associated with resistance to African trypanosomes, indicating its significance in terms of human evolutionary advantages.
title: Common homozygosity for predicted loss-of-function variants reveals both redundant and advantageous effects of dispensable human genes

finding: While described as related to cancer, the text indicates a trend toward significance but does not provide specific odds ratios or findings, distinguishing it from rs61745752 which had a definitive functional consequence and cancer association.
title: Coupling Metastasis to pH-Sensing GPR68 Using a Novel Small Molecule Inhibitor

finding: This SNP, located in the APOL1 gene, was found to be associated with end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) and was notably more frequent in African and African-American populations, with an allele frequency (AF) of 0.22 compared to an overall AF of 0.06 in gnomAD. In the IGSR dataset, it had an AF of 0.07 and a low Allele Dispersion Score (ADS) of 0.14, indicating that the variant was primarily carried by individuals from the AFR group.
title: Allele Dispersion Score: Quantifying the range of allele frequencies across populations, based on UMAP

finding: The study highlighted that the enhancer single nucleotide polymorphism rs5758550 was associated with variations in the functional status of CYP2D6 haplotypes. This finding was significant as it contributed to the understanding of CYP2D6 genotype variability and its implications for pharmacogenomic testing.
title: Transfer learning enables prediction of CYP2D6 haplotype function

finding: The research indicated that the SNP rs16947, represented by the CYP2D6 *2 allele, played an important role in CYP2D6 genotyping panels. This allele was linked to enhanced enzymatic activity and improved drug metabolism, thereby underlining its relevance in predicting individual drug responses.
title: Transfer learning enables prediction of CYP2D6 haplotype function

finding: The COMT rs4680 genotype was found to influence several personality traits as defined by the Five-Factor Model. Specifically, carriers of the Met allele demonstrated significantly higher levels of self-consciousness within the neuroticism domain. In comparison, Val allele carriers exhibited higher scores in extraversion, particularly in facets such as warmth, gregariousness, and positive emotions. Additionally, those with the Val allele also scored higher in competence and achievement striving within the conscientiousness domain. These associations suggest a complex interaction between the COMT genotype and personality, with Met carriers tending towards sensitivity to negative reinforcement and social inhibition, contrasting with Val carriers who displayed more approach-oriented behaviors.
title: Personality and MB-COMT gene: molecular-genetic and epigenetic associations with NEO-PI-R personality domains and facets in monozygotic twins

finding: The study provided evidence linking the rs6971 polymorphism of the TSPO gene to variations in TSPO availability assessed via [11C]PBR28 PET imaging. Participants were categorized as high-affinity binders (HABs) or mixed-affinity binders (MABs) based on their genotypes. This categorization was significant in the analysis of how age, sex, and BMI affected TSPO availability, contributing to the understanding of factors influencing TSPO binding in the brain.
title: Effects of age, BMI and sex on the glial cell marker TSPO - a multicentre [11C]PBR28 HRRT PET study

finding: The SNP rs73185306 was found to be modestly associated with HHV-6A/B with a P-value of 0.013 and an odds ratio (OR) of 2.38. In a replication study focusing only on integrated HHV-6A subjects, a stronger linkage was identified, with a P-value of 1.85E-05 and an OR of 7.36. This SNP was previously reported to associate with MOV10L1, suggesting a link to piRNA function.
title: Endogenization and excision of human herpesvirus 6 in human genomes

finding: The SNP rs566665421 was associated with integrated HHV-6A in a study of subjects with genome sequences available. This SNP was identified in long-read sequencing data and associated with the telomere of 22q where HHV-6A was integrated, supporting the hypothesis of a shared, ancient integration event of this HHV-6 variant.
title: Endogenization and excision of human herpesvirus 6 in human genomes

finding: Significant for increasing plasma abundances of catechol O-methyltransferase, this SNP showed a regional lead for BMI and was inversely related to body size measures.
title: Genetic architecture of host proteins interacting with SARS-CoV-2

finding: The SNP rs9611486 was recognized as a radial glial eQTL for EP300, which has rare variants linked to autism, developmental delay, and Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome 2. This SNP was also identified as a risk allele for anxiety symptoms, emphasizing its significance in related neurodevelopmental contexts.
title: Oxygen-induced stress reveals context-specific gene regulatory effects in human brain organoids

finding: The SNP rs397514502 involved a rare variant of human A4galt where a glutamine (Q) at position 211 was substituted with a glutamic acid (E) resulting in a mutein. This mutation influenced the enzyme's acceptor specificity towards GalNAc-capped oligosaccharides, leading to the synthesis of NOR1 and NOR2 antigens that are characterized by a Galα1→4GalNAc disaccharide. The mutation was noted to be present in only two families worldwide, highlighting its rarity and potential significance.
title: Delving into human α1,4-galactosyltransferase acceptor specificity: the role of enzyme dimerization

finding: The SNP rs5758550 was found to influence CYP2D6*2 phenotype and the formation of endoxifen in breast cancer patients undergoing tamoxifen treatment. This finding underscored the SNP's relevance in pharmacogenetic assessment for optimizing tamoxifen therapy.
title: A unifying model to predict variable drug response for personalised medicine

finding: The SNP rs16947 was associated with the CYP2D6 haplotypes, particularly the CYP2D6*2 allele, thereby impacting the genotyping panels used for assessing CYP2D6 activity. This provided significant insights into the genetic variability affecting drug metabolism.
title: A unifying model to predict variable drug response for personalised medicine

finding: The SNP rs13057823 colocalized with the Total Hip Replacement (THR) GWAS signal, influencing GCAT splicing in both PBS and FN-f conditions.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs2071910 colocalized with the THR GWAS signal, affecting GCAT splicing consistently across conditions.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs12160491 was identified as the index variant for the THR GWAS signal, confirming the involvement of related sQTLs in splicing events at the GCAT locus.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The COMT polymorphism (rs4680) related to the Val (valine) and Met (methionine) alleles was shown to be critical in the behavioral control context of the study. Individuals homozygous for either allele were selected for the experiment, and findings suggested that the COMT genotype influences the regulation of behavioral control, particularly through dopaminergic mechanisms.
title: A dopaminergic basis of behavioral control

finding: Similar to rs1109037, rs987640 also displayed a high MAF of 0.4963, indicating its importance in genetic analyses.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: This SNP was classified as a non-coding transcript exon variant of MIRLET7BHG, and it contributed to the height association findings in this analysis.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The SNP rs73885319, located in the APOL1 gene, was found to exhibit a significant difference in allele frequencies between the Sotho and Xhosa groups, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.03 in Sotho and 0.18 in Xhosa. This variation highlights the potential phenotypic implications linked to geographic and linguistic differences among South Eastern Bantu-speaking populations.
title: Genetic-substructure and complex demographic history of South African Bantu speakers

finding: The SNP rs133885 was replicated in the context of division ability with a p-value of 1.053×10^-5. It had previously been associated with general mathematical ability, suggesting a consistent relationship across different mathematical competencies.
title: A genome-wide association study identified new variants associated with mathematical abilities in Chinese children

finding: SNP rs855791 was strongly linked to hemoglobin concentration with a p-value of 3.49e-241 and a beta value of 0.0692. This variant was noted for its contribution to population-specific risk, especially in studies focused on individuals with sickle cell anemia.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: The rs874100 SNP (NM_153334.7:c.2459G>C) encoded a nonsynonymous variant that disrupted Z-DNA formation and influenced Z-RNA folding in SCARF2. It was identified as an eQTL for MED15, a gene associated with height.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The rs1558170 SNP was in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs874100, affecting MED15 expression; however, no direct eQTL role was specified, and its detailed contribution remained ambiguous.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The rs9610925 SNP was similarly linked to the expression of MED15 and connected with rs874100 for its potential impact on gene transcription.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The variant rs5751876 of the ADORA2A gene was genotyped in study participants and was associated with individual variabilities in response to caffeine effects on sleep. Specifically, the sensitivity to caffeine effects and the distribution of A1R were mentioned to be influenced by this genetic variant. The study emphasized the need to consider ADORA2A genotype in understanding the impact of caffeine on GM plasticity in response to chronic sleep restriction.
title: Repeated Caffeine Intake Suppresses Cerebral Grey Matter Responses to Chronic Sleep Restriction in an A1 Adenosine Receptor-Dependent Manner

finding: The TCN2 rs9606756 variant was identified as a risk locus for obesity-related traits, revealing its interaction with lipid metabolism.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 variant was associated with elevated transaminase levels in overweight/obese individuals, reflecting its role in liver health.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The finding related to the COMT Val158Met polymorphism (rs4680) indicated that it influenced local oscillation amplitudes and long-range temporal correlations (LRTCs) of neuronal oscillations. Homozygotes for Val158 exhibited higher COMT activity, leading to lower dopamine (DA) and norepinephrine (NE) levels compared to Met158 homozygotes, with heterozygotes displaying intermediate levels. This polymorphism was associated with modulation of neuronal activity in fMRI studies, particularly within the prefrontal cortex (PFC), and had implications for cognitive functions reliant on this brain region.
title: Genetic polymorphisms in COMT and BDNF influence synchronization dynamics of human neuronal oscillations

finding: The study identified rs5756795 as being in complete linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs58389158 in the British population. This SNP was part of a larger analysis of genetic risk factors for age-related hearing impairment (ARHI) and contributed to understanding the genetic landscape of auditory processes.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 44 independent genomic loci for self-reported adult hearing difficulty in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The PNPLA3 I148M variant (rs738409 C>G) was linked to a higher percentage of PGC-1α positive cells (p=0.0005, adjusted p=0.009) and was suggested to stimulate mitochondrial biogenesis in MASLD patients, although it did not correlate with overall mt-content.
title: Artificial intelligence as a ploy to delve into the intricate relationship between genetics and mitochondria in MASLD patients

finding: In the Peruvian cohort, SNP rs2330635 near the MIF gene was classified as under selection with an AdaptMix P-value of 7.06×10^-8, relating to immune function and associated with neutrophil counts.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: The SNP rs5765545 on chromosome 22 was associated with the planum temporale in the context of regional gray matter volume.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The rs1801311-G allele conferred SCZ risk by reducing neuronal differentiation capacity by 75%, as it disrupted binding motifs of several transcription factors, affecting the expression of NDUFA6.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The variant rs28371733 was identified as part of the CYP2D6 *106 star allele; its absence in NA18519 led to disagreements between different annotation methods.
title: Star allele search: a pharmacogenetic annotation database and user-friendly search tool of publicly available 1000 Genomes Project biospecimens

finding: The I157T CHEK2 variant (rs17879961) was initially associated in opposite directions with luminal A-like (OR=1.44, P=9.26×10⁻¹⁴) and TN (OR=0.61, P=2.55×10⁻⁴) tumors.
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP was associated with tumor grade (P=2.80×10⁻²).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Analysis of the genotype CYP2D6(*13+*2)/(*1) indicated that the haplotype *13 was associated with the variant at rs16947, with a ratio of 2.04. This was consistent with prior consensus genotype data.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: For the genotype CYP2D6(*4.013+*4)/(*4), the ratio for rs1135840 was 16.56, indicating that the sample had both SNPs present in the *4 haplotypes. This supported the presence of variant alleles related to this haplotype.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: In the genotype CYP2D6(*4.013+*4)/(*4), the defining SNP rs3892097 had a ratio of infinity, confirming the prior consensus genotype. This reinforced the association of this SNP with the expected haplotype.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: For the consensus genotype (*36+*10)/(*35), the ratio for rs1065852 was 1.22, which was lower than the expected ratio of 2 due to the presence of the variant alleles in *10 and *36, indicating a consistent genotype assignment.
title: Haplotype phasing of CYP2D6: an allelic ratio method using Agena MassARRAY data

finding: The rs4680 SNP also showed significant association with schizophrenia with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.245 (p<0.001). This non-synonymous SNP causes a significant reduction in COMT enzymatic activity.
title: Genetic risks of schizophrenia identified in a matched case-control study

finding: The rs5756095 variant was observed to create a predicted splicing acceptor site, which induced differential splicing. This differential splicing explained the changes in expression observed in the Griesemer MPRA, highlighting its role as a functional variant associated with gene expression regulation.
title: U-rich elements drive pervasive cryptic splicing in 3’ UTR massively parallel reporter assays

finding: The PNPLA3 rs738409 SNP was associated with liver fibrosis progression, portal hypertension, and hepatic steatosis among patients co-infected with HIV and HCV.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs3915951 was an exonic missense variant in CYP2D6 and was identified in heterozygous form in a single Papuan, suggesting it may impact function.
title: Archaic introgression and variation in pharmacogenes and implications for local adaptation

finding: The SNP rs139298 was associated with lung cancer through its role in creating the K121E mutation in APOBEC3H Haplotype I. This mutation destabilized APOBEC3H, which led to a loss of enzyme stability and significant genomic mutation activity. The findings suggested that a loss of A3H Hap I contributed to lung cancer, counter to the hypothesis that increased mutagenesis from APOBEC3 enzymes would be beneficial. This resulted in increased double-stranded DNA breaks in lung cancer cell lines that express APOBEC3B, suggesting an interaction between these enzymes that could promote tumor cell outcomes, such as immune recognition or death.
title: Induced mutagenesis by the DNA cytosine deaminase APOBEC3H Haplotype I protects against lung cancer

finding: This SNP had a high effect size associated with self-reported high cholesterol in the UK Biobank and demonstrated consistent higher effect sizes across related traits (HDL, LDL, total cholesterol, triglycerides) in the Million Veterans Program, placing it among the top 10% of variants by effect size for these traits.
title: Diverse transcriptomic signatures across human tissues identify functional rare genetic variation

finding: The rs9606250 SNP in DGCR8 was connected to the survival of breast cancer patients.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The SNP rs134873 was found within a second fetal brain-specific risk-associated enhancer at chr22:42657000-42658000. It demonstrated significant association with differential enhancer activity in MPRA assays and was linked to expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs) for several genes including FAM109B, NAGA, LINC00634, and WBP2NL, indicating its relevance to genetic risk for schizophrenia.
title: Regulome-wide association study identifies enhancer properties associated with risk for schizophrenia

finding: Similar to rs3063368, the SNP rs755622 was also found to be a significant polymorphism associated with the MIF gene promoter. The correlation between this SNP and acute kidney injury and mortality following cardiac surgery further illustrated its role in inflammatory responses in atherosclerosis and related cardiovascular conditions, thereby constituting a positive and original finding.
title: Link between aging and atheroprotection in Mif-deficient atherosclerotic mice

finding: The rs5751901 polymorphism in the GGT1 gene was associated with an increased risk of acute pancreatitis in smokers, indicating its potential role as a genetic risk factor for the disease.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: This likely causal variant showed associations with opposite directions of effects for luminal A-like and TN disease.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The rs17879961 variant was highlighted as a likely causal variant associated with risk of multiple cancer types, exhibiting complex effects.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs972578 was associated with platelet count in humans. This was evidenced by its linkage to the gene NAGA, whose expression showed a significant negative correlation with parasitemia (logFC = -4.63, p = 2.18 × 10^-6). This finding illustrated the involvement of the NAGA gene in the immune response to malaria-like parasites.
title: Immunogenetic response to a malaria-like parasite in a wild primate

finding: The SNP rs8137128 was linked to blood protein measurements through its association with the gene TBC1D9B. The expression of TBC1D9B also negatively correlated with parasitemia (logFC = -1.33, p = 4.36 × 10^-5), emphasizing its role in the primate response to malaria-like infections and underlying immune mechanisms.
title: Immunogenetic response to a malaria-like parasite in a wild primate

finding: The 'C' allele of the top eSNP (rs5751775) for DDT (D-dopachrome tautomerase), which is functionally related to MIF (migration inhibitory factor), increased DDT transcription in resting T cells but decreased expression after PHA stimulation, indicating condition-dependent alterations.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The rs73885319 SNP was associated with high-risk variants (2RV) in APOL1, leading to depressed baseline and maximum mitochondrial oxygen consumption in HUVECs, as well as impaired mitochondrial function, indicating significant involvement in endothelial cytotoxicity.
title: APOL1 variant-expressing endothelial cells exhibit autophagic dysfunction and mitochondrial stress

finding: Similar to rs73885319, the rs60910145 SNP was identified within the high-risk APOL1 variants (2RV) that compromised mitochondrial respiration and led to lysosomal dysfunction in endothelial cells.
title: APOL1 variant-expressing endothelial cells exhibit autophagic dysfunction and mitochondrial stress

finding: The rs71785313 SNP, part of the G2 APOL1 variants, was implicated in the observed autophagic defect and detrimental impact on lysosomal integrity in the context of cytokine-induced expression in HUVECs.
title: APOL1 variant-expressing endothelial cells exhibit autophagic dysfunction and mitochondrial stress

finding: The SNP rs5758389 was mentioned as having multiple effects that contribute to the expression predictions related to the gene ACO2. This gene was identified as being potentially downregulated in Europeans and upregulated in Native American populations, indicating specific population-level selection that might affect its regulatory variants.
title: A gene-level test for directional selection on gene expression

finding: The COMT Val158Met polymorphism (rs4680) was linked to pain perception in multiple sclerosis, indicating its role in pain mechanisms.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SOX10 gene polymorphism rs139883 was associated with the age of onset in schizophrenia, suggesting its potential involvement in neurological disorders.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The variant rs369691 was identified as an eQTL for the gene GSTT2, showcasing extensive sharing across all tissues during the context-specific analysis. However, after applying the FastGxC method, it was determined that two specific eQTLs emerged in the two different skin tissues.
title: Fast and powerful statistical method for context-specific QTL mapping in multi-context genomic studies

finding: The SNP rs139298, which causes the K121E mutation in APOBEC3H Haplotype I, was originally reported to be associated with lung cancer. It was further established that this mutation led to the destabilization of APOBEC3H, thus contributing to cancer evolution. Specifically, the K121E alteration disrupted the enzyme's structure and catalytic activity, resulting in significant genomic mutations in lung cancer cells. The findings suggested that the absence of APOBEC3H Haplotype I was associated with lung cancer, countering the typical understanding of mutagens in cancer advancement.
title: Induced mutagenesis by the DNA cytosine deaminase APOBEC3H Haplotype I protects against lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs6971 was associated with the binding affinity of the PET radioligand [(18)F]-FEPPA, highlighting its significant role in influencing in-vivo brain imaging outcomes. This finding illustrated the relevance of the Translocator protein (18 kDa) polymorphism in neuroimaging studies, thereby linking genetic variation with neuroimaging metrics.
title: Imaging transcriptomics: Convergent cellular, transcriptomic, and molecular neuroimaging signatures in the healthy adult human brain

finding: The rs6151429 variant was associated with increased expression of the long isoform of the ARSA gene transcript, corroborating previous evidence of this association, although it was not categorized as a PAS-altering variant.
title: The genetic determinants of the relative expression of alternative 3’UTR isoforms in human

finding: The SNP rs1947, related to the <italic>paired</italic>∷Gal4 genetic construct, demonstrated that microtubule self-organization in <italic>Drosophila</italic> does not depend on the dynamics of individual microtubules, indicating a robustness at the tissue level within the biological system. This finding suggested a generic mechanism underlying the robustness of microtubules in cellular environments.
title: Robustness of bidirectional microtubule network self-organization

finding: The study identified an association between the COMT Val158Met polymorphism (rs4680) and coping styles in long-tailed macaques. Specific coping styles, defined as 'emotion-focused' and 'problem-focused', were linked to the presence of the Val/Met variant. Individuals with different genotypes exhibited consistent patterns correlating with emotional arousal as measured by infrared thermography. This finding was significant as it progressed the understanding of coping mechanisms in non-human primates, previously studied mainly in humans.
title: Behavioural, physiological, and genetic drivers of coping

finding: The SNP rs62223875 in the ESS2 gene was associated with suicide death, contributing to the identification of five novel, high-impact, rare SNPs. This finding adds to the understanding of genetic risk factors for suicide.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: The SNP rs6006399 in the gene HORMAD2 at 22q12.1 showed a significant association with forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) with a p-value of 1.9×10^{-18}. This highlighted its role in lung function.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The Val/Val polymorphism of the COMT val158met allele (rs4680) was associated with an increased frequency of problem gambling behavior. This SNP codes for a more active form of the COMT enzyme, which presumably leads to lower frontal dopamine levels, indicating that reduced frontal dopamine might increase the likelihood of problem gambling.
title: Dopamine and risky decision-making in pathological and problem gamblers

finding: The frameshift variant in CHEK2 was significantly associated with breast cancer, exhibiting an odds ratio of 2.04 and a P-value of 6.98×10^-22. This finding related to a study population of 12,636 breast cancer cases and 200,417 controls.
title: Sequencing of 53,831 diverse genomes from the NHLBI TOPMed Program
